Reviews.Title: “A Touch of France”
Reviews.Author: MsWitt
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. We love it! The elevator and the rooms are small, just like in Europe. The location on Bush Street is great. A buffet breakfast is included every morning....eggs, fresh fruit, wonderful fresh bread or baguettes ..... all served in a cozy little dining room. The perfect start to the day! There is also wine tasting in the evening with hors-d-oeuvres, A perfect time for sharing the day's event with fellow guests. A lot of the returning guests are European. We love everything about it and will return as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Petite Auberge”
Reviews.Author: HintonTN
Reviews.Content: After reading so many of the reviews on Trip Advisor we made reservations and could not have been more pleased. A fabulous and safe location, charming decor, fabulous breakfast and quaint afternoon snacks with wine. Truly, we cannot think of one bad thing to say. This is not a new establishment -- it is older, but so well kept and truly charming.

Reviews.Title: “Charming non-sterile inn, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TheChairmanMeow
Reviews.Content: A charming olde worlde inn near Union Square and convenient to public transport. Full of character and not sterile like the big chain hotels. Friendly staff, and rather ancient elevator. Super friendly staff. But note that reception is not always manned - sometimes you need to go a few doors up for staff at White Swan Inn. Hotel is only a few blocks from Market St and Union Sq for shopping, and Muni/BART etc. Great full breakfast, and evening wine reception in comfortable lounge area daily. Free wifi available and reasonable number of TV channels. Shower was quite small - I'm tall and my elbows hit the shower wall while washing hair - but bathroom ok in general. Definitely on my list for future San Francisco visits.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: annie2323
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Petite Auberge ... wish we could have been there longer. Location is great - on a fairly quiet street only a few blocks from Powell and Union Square, and also a short walk to Chinatown. Loved the delicious breakfast (huge!), also the fun afternoon wine and appetizers served in a charming fireside common space where we chatted with other guests. Rooms were very clean and well-appointed. OId but charming hotel, full of European character. Very fair price. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: gandolftx
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The rooms are small but very comfortable. The breakfast and afternoon cocktails and Hors d'oeuvres are a brilliant touch. The hotel is walking distance from Union Square and China Town. It is a block and a half from the Cable car stop which will take you to the BART Station if you are coming from or going to the airport or anywhere else the BART services. I had a great time and highly recommend this hidden treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel with a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jukka W
Reviews.Content: Old but cosy small boutique hotel . Fantastic location and the valet parking system works very well. We had a very small room which had seen better days but it was clean which is most important thing. Freshly cooked breakfasts are good and the staff was very friendly . Free wine and cheese service every evening was a nice bonus. Overall I think we very pretty satisfied with the value.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't for the wine & cheese...”
Reviews.Author: SSViaje
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quaint, friendly and sweet. However it is showing it's age. Rooms are tiny & noise can be a problem, however our room (facing a brick wall) wasn't too bad. As much as I'd like to say I liked it, because the staff was so friendly, I probably won't be going back. Hubbie and I were disappointed to be put in one of the smallest rooms, even though we made a reservation months in advance. The big plus: nightly wine & cheese was a wonderful way to meet fellow travelers from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: rayfor
Reviews.Content: Nice neighborhood. Wine service in the evening and freshly made breakfast, changing everyday. Older building but well maintained and nicely appointed. Very french but modern enough. Quint elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint style "Old San Francisco" hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeaLoon
Reviews.Content: Great for a couple. Stayed here four nights for a SF tourist visit. Very nice breakfast with lots of choices. Pleasant and convivial wine & hors d'vours hour. Great location. Negatives: can be very noisy (street noise) as you have to open windows for coolness and with late arriving / early leaving guests. If you want something off the beaten path, this is it. Other reviews are very accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a weekend, but not for a biz trip”
Reviews.Author: mysterioustraveler
Reviews.Content: I'll start with what made this a great value for under $150 a night: Spacious room (on the quiet 5th floor), gracious staff, and comfy bed â€” plus the gas fireplace for taking the winter chill off. I'd recommend the Petite Auberge for a theater weekend or tourist visit to San Francisco. I made the mistake of booking it for a business trip, and it was just not streamlined enough. The tiny mirror on the inside of the wardrobe door â€” which didn't stay open unless you wedged it against the bed â€” was not what I needed to check what I was wearing, and the vintage wooden desk wasn't what I needed for a workspace. Lighting was dim. The location is in a neighborhood that's still transitional â€” I was with my male partner, or I wouldn't have walked on the street at night by myself (daytime is fine). The buffet breakfast offerings were varied and decent â€” both traditional breakfast foods and low-calorie options. (The only disappointment there is the tea â€” the water in the pre-heated container was not really hot enough, and had an off-taste that overpowered the teabag.) We were a bit miffed that our bill automatically charged us for a daily donation to a charity â€” giving us the option to donate, rather than forcing us to opt out would have been much classier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except.......”
Reviews.Author: melk100
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently spent 4 nights here. This is definitely a European style hotel; small rooms, older building, no heat in the hallways, tilting and somewhat creaky floors. All that being said, we loved our stay and the charm of the place which is why we chose it. Would definitely recommend a room with a fireplace if your going during the colder months and also ask for a top floor room as we moved from our second floor location due to the ceiling above use creaking noisily every time the occupants above us walked across their floor. The breakfast buffet and wine reception are very nicely done and set in the cozy space downstairs from the entry area. We didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff but everyone we encountered was very nice and helpful. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the bed is probably one of the worst I've encountered in my travels. Every time one person or the other moves or turns over the entire bed moved and shakes and neither my sister nor I are restless sleepers. Needless to say, we did not have a restful night of sleep in our 4 days. The other slightly negative mark is the lighting is very difficult. They are using cfl's which I completely understand for environmental reasons but there are new, better models available. The lighting in the lamps over the beds cannot be dimmed so if you wish to read you feel like you're under a spotlight; the bathroom lighting is difficult until you let the lamps warm up to reach their full brightness. Other than that, would stay there again if they get new mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hideaway in SF”
Reviews.Author: EastwestUSA
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a four night stay at this wonderful little hotel. Our room was a queen with a fireplace, and was very comfortable. Great bed, the fire was very welcomed as it was cold and rainy most of our stay. Breakfast buffet was very good, the only small drawback was that they had the same egg dish fhe first two mornings. Other days were different. Afternoon, they served hot and cold appetizers and white and red wine near their fireplace. Great place to meet and greet. Location was terrific, less than two blocks from the cable car, and a reasonable walk to the Bart station on Market Street. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “The good AND the bad”
Reviews.Author: TomerMic
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 4 nights at the hotel. The good: The location is great - 5 minutes walk from union square. The staff was friendly and helpful The home-made food was yummi and the complimentary wine - a real treat! The rooms with the fireplace are very romantic. The bad: The room we were offered when we checked in was tiny, with a lovely view of a brick wall some 2 meters away. For a small extra (which was refunded later - for reasons I'll mention shortly) we were offered a room on the ground floor (#16), which had much more light but was frozen (the fireplace couldn't do the trick), and noisy - the sound of people walking over our heads on the wooden floors or the showers they took have woken us every day at 5AM!! Its location near the dining room didn't help either... Finally we moved to a room on the top floor (#56) which was much more quite (but you could hear very well every time someone opened the faucet in the next room or just left an alarm clock and wend out for dinner!) and a little warmer. In conclusion - cute hotel, but we'll probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Treasure in Heart of City!”
Reviews.Author: emeraldhillstraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a Joie De Vivre member so I looked for hotels in city as I was attending an event and needed a hotel just for one night. Staff was fantastic and helpful, check in was easy despite having to go to 2 doors down to White swan their sister hotel. I got the valet package which was so worth it. They gave me the number to the hotel and i called while shopping and 20 minutes later arrived at the hotel and my car was waiting in valet spot in front of hotel. The room was adorable, received upgrade to fireplace room with bay window. Love the old style elevator. Wine reception was delicious and fun. Love the 24 hours coffee and beverages. Breakfast was beyond any normal continental breakfast, hot and delicious with lots of choices. Love the old style real keys for rooms. One traveler was furiously yelling at the staff that he was not given enough keys and could not open his door. The staff member politely finished with me, then personally walked him to his door to show him how to use the keys properly instead of pointing out it was his error. Handled beautifully. Room was quiet. The sister hotel looked slightly nicer, but I could care less. i loved the charm, the rooms, the food, and the price was just an incredible deal! I booked online directly thru the joie de vivre website. I just stayed at omni with my 3 kids in december and loved it. however for a little romance and adult getaway this place is a treasure! I would choose this for couples and a little romantic getaway anyday. A real value for the location, service and amenities and charm. My only suggestion would be to get better mattresses but i slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Respite in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie338
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel by happy accident. I was planning on staying at a five star hotel on Nob Hill and just couldnt bring myself to deal with the hugeness of the property at the last minute. The Petite Auberge was just down the hill from the fancy, high priced hotels and offered a much more relaxed and homey feel. My room was on the 4th floor at the end of the hall with a fireplace and queen bed. beautiful, french country style furnishings and a touch of old world charm. Very clean and comfortable. Loved the old style elevator and the quietness of the property. Great buffet breakfast the next day. Much better than the fare offered at the big chain Suite Hotels. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars, was that I accidently left a presciption in my room and after searching everywhere after I got home, realized I left it there. I had to call them and ask them to send it back. Better customer service would have been for them to contact me. They had all my information on file, including my name on the pill bottle. Other than that, A great stay. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A place with real charm”
Reviews.Author: Birthdaygirl01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most character of any I have stayed in. We chatted to some charming fellow guests over wine in the lovely lounge. The fireplace in our room made it feel very romantic and the lift has to be experienced (original wrought iron). Convenient location too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Gem in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Brigitgoddess
Reviews.Content: We spent the night in this boutique hotel while attending an event in San Francisco. I found them through the Joie de Vivre hotel network online. I am a big fan of small, historic hotels and this did not disappoint. The hotel is just a few blocks from Union Square and so is very convenient to a lot of shopping, etc, but since it is a wee bit away from the Square, it's much quieter than you would expect. Loved the little touches such as free soda or bottled water (down near the kitchen), home-baked cookies and free internet. The buffet breakfast in the morning was WONDERFUL! Definitely miles above what is often offered for breakfast when it is included in the cost of the room at other places. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. If I were to stay here again (and I probably will) I would be sure to upgrade to a larger room with a larger bed. We got the double bed in their smallest room and it felt a bit tight. The only complaint I could possibly make (and what kept me from giving them an Excellent rating) was that the mattress in our room seemed old and worn out. Not the most comfortable I've ever slept on with obvious signs that it had seen better days. Other than that--I'd recommend this hotel wholeheartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jahoran
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in late November/Early December and would go back in a heartbeat. About 5mins from Powell Street and Union Square but still in a quiet neighbourhood means it has a perfect location. We stayed in a cozy queen and the room was nice and big. The best part was the little touches - free drinks constantly available, little treats left out at the desk and then the reception with wine every day at 5. The breakfast was varied and always nice with lots of choices. There were some downsides however - the shower was a little basic, the television had one channel and perhaps worst of all was the fact that the reception desk was almost always unattended which meant we had to go to the White Swan down the road to ask questions etc. Also, there were no internet facilities - something which I feel is a fairly basic requirement nowadays. Overall it still was a great base for our holiday and I would thoroughly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Not a 'theme hotel' just a fantastic hotel with charecter with nice extras”
Reviews.Author: Perrin123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 fantastic nights at tge PA. Arrived early and was offered the room straight away. Some would describe this as a french 'themed' hotel, but the quality, attention to detail, and the consistency make this far from a theme hotel. This hotel has charecter, from the rooms to public areas. The rooms are fairly small, but not so small to be a problem...its a city hotel in the USA...therefore I would count the space generous compared to New York. My room was next to the lift, which you could here a slight rumble, but nothing that was going to keep me awake. The room and the public areas were clean. The furnishings were nice with a very comfortable bed...which is in the main what you have a hotel for...a good nights sleep. Breakfast was nice, something a bit different to the normal plastic continental served at most chain hotels. Wine in the parlour was a nice touch served early evening for all guests. Staff were friendly, and especially housekeeping who did a fantastic job, and were always especially friendly when we saw them around the hotel. The property isnt over run with staff, the main reception being at their sister property next door...don't be expecting bells and whistles reception with conceirges, bell hops etc...it feels more like your own country house in the peace and quiet. Hot drinks, soft drinks, water was all availible free of charge to help yourself to as you wish from the kitchen area...this to me is what a hotel is about...the nice little extras. The hotel is in a good area, easy walking distance to downtown and public transport. I would definately stay here again, whether business or pleasure and is quite possibly one of my favourites of all time. A great hotel which I will highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but a bit far from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: alohatripper
Reviews.Content: Nov 4-7, 2011 Located between Taylor and Mason on Bush, this property is a good 5 blocks from Union Square and a block down from Nob Hill. We stayed two nights in a "cozy queen" and one night in a "fireplace queen." The former room #43 was typically smaller with a tiny bathroom. The shower was so tight that turning around could cause your elbow to turn the water faucet handles and change the setting. The wooden floors were very creaky that could wake someone in the room or in a room below. The "fireplace queen" was relatively roomier with a tub and a working gas-fed fireplace. The housekeeping was on par with the best properties. There is no view except for the exterior wall of an adjacent building. Every room has motorized window shades. Recommended parking at State Garage is two blocks away on Leavenworth at $20/night with no in-out privileges. I didn't have much contact with the staff. The free breakfasts had the usual plus two or three hot entrees that changed daily. This is a solid choice although a bit far from Union Square. The immediate area is for me rather sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs77
Reviews.Content: I would like to say what a fantastic time we had staying at Petite Auberge. What a little gem this place is. Firstly I would like to say how excellent the location was with only a block and a half away from the cable cars cross street stop and only 3 blocks from Union Square. The rooms themselves are quaint and very homely. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was immaculately clean. The room had a beautiful little fireplace which was perfect for coming home getting warm on a cold windy night and the room was spacious enough for us to store our 4 large suitcases and still have room to move. Please do not pay attention to any reviews complaining about times that the front desk in unattended becuase there is always somebody available either at their front desk or the desk at the white swan which is directly next door and litterally 20 steps from the door. The staff were so kind and very helpful, they gave us reccommendations on where and where not to go around the city for nice meals and sighseeing. Each night the hotel had a complimentary wine/cheese reception which we fantastic - for us travelling from Australia it gave us the opportunity to try different californian wines which and to enjoy lots of the home cooked delicious treats which tied us over until dinner time. For the people that like to mingle with other guests / travellers this is a great way to meet new people and share stories about good places to visit around the area but if mingleing is not your thing you can go and help yourself to a couple of glasses of wine, some yummy food and go and sit on one of the comfortable lounges and read a book or listen to some music or even go up to your room. Fresh cooked breakfast of a morning was tops and the chef was so friendly and helpful. There is a fridge in the downstairs kitchen which offers complimentary water and soda - this extra little touch definately did not go un noticed with us as having the convenience of grabbing a refreshment so easily and complimentary before heading out for some sightseeing or returning home for the day was a great gesture that went a long way. Every day there was also fresh home baked goodlies left in a jar in the foyer so everytime we walked in or out we were able to indulge in some delicious treats. This hotel goes above and beyond to make you feel like its a home away from home and I have no hestitation to reccommend it to anyone. If ever we make the trek back to SFO we will most definately stay at Petie Auberge again. If you have time make sure you head to Pier 33 and do the Alcatraz Tour with audio headsets - this was a great day out. We also did a Nappa & Sonoma Valley Wine Tour . Although the person selling us the tickets told us it was 6 wineries we would be visiting it ended up being just 3 however this ended up being ok as we were able to take our time and enjoy the 3 places we went to other than rush through all. The red bus ticket seller also failed to tell us that ontop of the tour fee we would actually have to pay each winery a $5 or $10 per person tasting so make sure you factor in another $40 ontop of the ticket. If you have the time try and check out Yosemite National Park - We were picked up at 6am from the hotel, we found out it was actually a 5.5 hour drive to Yosemite each way plus more time for pit stops and coffee breaks so we only got 3 hours at the actual park before heading back for another long bus ride home. Our tour driver was really nice and very informative which did make the trip go faster but it was a long day because we were not dropped back at our hotel until about 10pm at night so the 12 hour tour that the red bus ticket seller sold us on ended up being a little over 16 hours. We were budgeting on being back in the city at around 6-6.30 pm so getting home at 10pm basically meant we lost a night of sightseeing which was pretty disappointing however in the grand scheme of things it was ok becuase we don't regret having the opportunity to going to see Yosemite and will remember the day forever. For a great dinner check out Loris Diner (Opposite Drake Hotel). For a diner this place was AMAZING ! I ordered the roast turkey dinner and it was honesty the best meal I had in the entire time in San Francisco. The 2 previous nights we dined fine dining and paid about 3-4 times the amount we paid at Loris but the food didnt even come close. Crazy! Even when I ordered a strawberry milkshake I was anticipating the normal artifically flavoured drink but it was made with real strawberrys and was amazing. The service was fantastic too and our waitress was such a sweet girl and very friendly. If you go on a Friday they serve their house specialty of Clam Chowder which my husband ordered and said it was nicer than the chowder he tried down on Pier 39 / Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Not the type of hotel we usually choose but we are glad we tried it.”
Reviews.Author: delaine
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of reviews on this site and so glad we did. We had such a good time. Our room and bathroom were so clean and so comfortable. Kudos to the lovely woman who did the cleaning, she was a gem. The bathroom is quite small but it was spotless. Our room had a fireplace and a window that overlooked a small garden. Lovely. Breakfast was excellent and the complementary wine and snacks and mingling with the other guests before heading out to dinner was a real bonus. We travel to San Francisco often and this will be our first choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: WeloveB-Bs
Reviews.Content: First time here - stayed 3 nights, weather was hot for San Fran - 81 during the day. We had a queen fireplace room - very roomy with windows on both sides of the room so a good breeze existed. It would have been very warm without the breeze - no air conditioning - but in San Fran only a handful of days would require air - just these three. Breakfast was hot, with an egg dish, a meat side dish and all the usually other items, pastries, cereal, breads, juice - great coffee. Be aware of a specific unloading zone in front of hotel - right next to it is a tow away zone - but the bellman pointed that out and moved cars around to make space. Small cage elevator - never had to wait more than a minute- stairs right next to it - best for going down. Check in/out was excellent, and front staff helped us find a long lost favorite restaurant we were looking for - based on a general location and a description of the block it was on. He found it in 4-5 minutes. What individual service!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: MITIJ
Reviews.Content: Three couples stayed in this three story adorable little hotel. Not modern and very french in its quaint appearance. The most significant part of our two night stay was Andy, who was the friendliest person at a hotel that I have ever met! I have no idea what Andy's job title is, but he was everywhere we were in that hotel. He was so helpful with advise and information, it was great that he steered us in the right direction with many helpful hints. Also, Joel, (I think his name was Joel), the chef for breakfast, was wonderful and very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was wonderful with homemade irish soda bread and lots of nice goodies. There was a wine respite in the late afternoon, but we were not there for that. And when we returned from dinner, there were lovely pastries awaiting us in the hallway. I don't know if they were good, because I did not try any. Petite Auberge is pretty centrally located. Chinatown is close by and Fisherman's Wharf is just a bus ride away. The rooms were small-ish. They were very tired looking and could use a coat of paint and new carpet. It was a very warm October and without A/C I don't know how anyone can stay here in the summer. We left the windows open to sleep and the noise from a bar/party close by had the noise level at a fever pitch. There was a very nice gas powered fireplace, so winters can probably be very nice. We are not in the room except to sleep, so all in all, not so bad. If you need anything, you have to go next door to the sister hotel, since Petite Auberge is not manned except for check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Petit Auberge”
Reviews.Author: RoMiItaly
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. It was very quaint and inviting and the staff was very helpful. Our room was clean and well equipped, although small. The only thing we woudl have liked for it to have had a ceiling fan. It was somewhat warm in SF that weekend and we ended up having the windows open at all times as the room was a bit stuffy. The evening wine reception was great and it was nice to get to meet other guests. The breakfast was delicious and they varied it each day, which was a nice touch. Their coffe was deilcious! Again, the staff was wonderful. One morning, I woke up very early (still on east coast time), and I went downstairs to see if I could get a cup and they were very accommodating. I recommend the hotel to anyone who likes the smaller inns with the personal touches.

Reviews.Title: “Petit bijou "beautiful small jewel house"”
Reviews.Author: Soleil060
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Petite Auberge purely based on the reviewed on Tripadvisor. I asked for a quiet room I got 55 wonderful, everywhere in thye Auberge it smells and looks clean. Breafast different and good every day. In the reception hall cookies jar changed and different every day. Wine and cheese very generous and varied every night. I was impressed with helful staff in the nice dining rooom

Reviews.Title: “Re: Quaint, homely and great value”
Reviews.Author: JOHN C
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just come back from our trip, and we stayed at the Petite Auberge purely based on the reviews on trip advisor... we were not disappointed. Firstly, when booking online we got a great deal for 2 nights. Our plans then changed and we had to book an extra night. However, we were not able to get the same rate online, and it was considerably more, so I emailed the hotel directly to ask if we could stay an extra night at the lower rate we were paying. Their reply was prompt and they were happy to oblige; this already gave us high hopes for our stay there. A few reviewers have highlighted the issue of having to go 'next door' to their neighbouring hotel to check-in etc, when there is no one manning the desk at the Petite, but this really isn't a bother as it is seconds away and they are reachable by phone if you have any questions. The place itself is a haven from the city, with their comfy sofas and a fireplace. We did have a room that was next to the lift, but it wasn't too much of a bother for me, even though I'm a light sleeper. Others may want to request a different room if they are light sleepers! Our room was small, but very adequate and cute. It was clean and the shower was great. The breakfasts were hearty and put you in good stead for the day, the fridge of water and sodas is a brilliant idea, seeing as other hotels can charge up to $3-$5 for water! The homemade cookies in the jar on the little table and the wine/canapes evening, are touches that give this hotel real charm. I highly recommend the Petite Auberge and will definitely stay here again. The location is perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - the amenities are fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: C F
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 5 nights, while in town for the Nike Marathon. At first glance, being used to the typical corporate chain hotels, we were both disappointed when we arrived to our room. However, the charm of this place becomes apparent rather quickly. We too, had a corner room, just like a previous reviewer - room #51. It is immediately next to the elevator, and facing the street. The room is plenty big for 2 people with a fireplace, sofa, an upholstered chair and a desk with chair. I see no reason to avoid a room by the elevator - on the contrary, I found it quite convenient. The street noise is present, but either sleep with your windows shut or turn on the provided "noise machine" and you'll be fine. The amenities are such that I've never experienced at any other hotel before. They keep a refrigerator fully stocked with bottled water & sodas, for you to take whenever you'd like. There is always a bowl of apples available, coffee & tea. Starting in the afternoons, and going straight through to after dinner, there is a cookie jar kept stocked with fresh baked cookies. A different type of cookie appeared every day, and often times we were at the jar while the cookies were still warm! When dropping off your parcels or running in to change clothes, having a bottle of water and a small snack is a welcome find. The breakfast is adequate. It's enough to get you started on your day. I agree that the set up is a bit of a disaster, having the coffee/tea immediately outside of the elevator doors. I enjoyed my daily cup of coffee and croissant with jam! We did not take full advantage of the wine/cheese reception. We did stop in, grab a few glasses of wine to take up to our room while getting ready for dinner, but the people who were down there were social and it was a friendly atmosphere. Overall, I recommend this hotel, and if staying in the Union Square area again, I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, Bed and Breakfast hotel Plus.”
Reviews.Author: TWRyan.
Reviews.Content: Close walking distance to Union Square. At First glance the hotel which shares staff with the next door White Swan, looks a bit dated and in need of a face lift. This however hides a good suprise as The rooms are comfortable, styled as old fashioned, but it is the extras which make the difference. Breakfast was very good, plenty of choice, seved in the sitting room area in the basement. There is also a little garden area off the comfortable sitting room. We admit to. at first being a little dissapointed and only appreciated this venue when we came in after a days sightseeing and were rewarded by a lovely evening offering of some wine and cake, served in the sitting room, while we read and chatted to other guests.(not compulsary).Another nice touch was the jar of Cookies at reception. A word of warning, the rooms do vary, some located near street can be noise, avoid the one near the lift. We were lucky and offered a choice of two. We will go back for its convience and little extras but not for a touch of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good... Bordering on Great. And a wonderful value.”
Reviews.Author: JHMPLS
Reviews.Content: Short story is that we would both recommend this hotel and stay here again. There were many, many great reasons to stay here. And a few things you should know (nothing terrible)... read on! We liked the location quite a bit. We like to walk and were less than a 15 minute walk from most of the things we wanted to see. The BART stop was about 10 minutes. The hills are significant but that's the case almost anywhere you stay in SF. The hotel itself is super cute. A real gem. It has an old-world charm with most modern conveniences. By "most," don't expect an oversized bathtub or two sinks in the bathroom. We had a room (51) which was oversized with a fireplace. Really a nice setup. That room is also nice because it's at the end of the hall, separated from other rooms by the stairwell, so it was also quite quiet. The breakfast was included in our rate and was tasty. Each day had a different hot dish (quiche or breakfast casserole), pastries, breakfast meat, assorted cereals, yogurt, etc. Tasty. Finally, you'll be well fed. A cookie/treat jar is stocked all afternoon (fresh baked) and there's an afternoon happy hour with wines and light snacks. For full and fair disclosure, there are a few things you should know so you're not surprised: - The front desk is only staffed a few hours each afternoon. If you need something you need to call or walk two doors down to their sister hotel. Not a big deal. - The lobby is on the second floor and there are also rooms on 3, 4 and 5. And there's one old-fashioned elevator (the kind where you have to open a door and slide a cage door manually). We never had to wait for the elevator -- but there's only one. - Our bathroom was clean... but could have used some updates. The tile was from the '70's. The wallpaper had minor peeling and stains in spots. - The windows were filthy. And most could have been washed from the fire escape. - Finally, although the breakfast is quite tasty the breakfast area is not "calming." The food is along one wall and the coffee/tea/toast is along another wall near the elevator. Everyone ends up bumping into each other trying to get their food and drink. I actually think this could be fixed by reconfiguring the setup. (Sorry... it's a disease. I have a background in Operations Management and always want to reengineer.)

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Coyote88
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel before flying out to Hawaii. The location is great but the hotel was a mixture of good and average. The average - Room small by American standards, there was no Wi-fi, the reception was not manned for 24 hours and when unattended you had to use the 'White Swan' next door and finally the breakfast area only had about seven or eight tables. The good - All facilities were very clean, bath robes were provided, the staff were exceedingly helpful and there was free wine, coffee and nibbles in the comfortable lounge every tea time to allow the guests to 'mingle'. If we went back we might try the White Swan!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & cozy”
Reviews.Author: bbfan415
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in March 2011in a Cozy Queen room, was definitely cozy for 2 people, bed was very comfortable. Our room and bathroom was clean, hotel was quiet, we stayed in the room close to the elevator. Hotel had a musty odor, breakfast was good and a variety of breakfast items compared to other hotels. They offered boil eggs, quiche, toast, fruit, cereal, pastries, oatmeal, coffee & tea, juice. After 5 days, I found the breakfast to be repetitious, nonetheless a great start to the day. They do offer wine and cheese late afternoon, generous portions and very good. After returning from a long day, it was nice to have some home made baking available. The hotel is located 10 mins from union square down hill, up hill on the way back to the hotel, Victoria style, great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: SareyW
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel. We went for the 'cozy queen' room and yes it was on the small side but perfectly adequate for our needs, lovely decor and great shower. The breakfast and treats throughout the day set it apart from other hotels, as did the friendly and helpful staff, and we loved the excellent location near to Union Square and Chinatown. The only downside was the noise. We were in the room right next to reception and the lift, and it was very noisy. I would expect some noise from an older style hotel but found it difficult to sleep as most of the noise was later in the evening and particularly early in the morning when people were checking out. On the upside there was no street noise. I would recommend this hotel, just ask for a room on the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn, great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: onagetaway
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at the Petite Auberge. We booked based on reviews at this site and were not disappointed! The price was very affordable for SF and the location near Union Square was perfect for walking to restaurants, shopping, tour bus and cable cars. The ambience was very warm and cozy. Our street level room, Queen Deluxe with FP had ample space, was very clean and bed very comfortable. All linens were of high quality. Breakfast was delicious with hot quiche, meat and fresh fruit daily. We made it to one evening wine reception, and after arriving late, the attentive staff brought out more wine as the guests continued to have lively conversation by the warm fire on a cool evening! We appreciated his effort very much. We also received excellent customer service when there was a slight problem with towels in our room, after a call to the front desk, staff immediately arrived to correct the problem just minutes later. A late check-in next door at the White Swan was very easy and we appreciated staying in a secure building, although we felt quite comfortable walking in the area day and night. The parent company has many choices in the SF area, but we prefer small, boutique style hotel and this hit the mark! We had previously stayed at a Joie de Vivre hotel in Europe, clearly this is a company that strives for excellence, and we will stay with them again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Value”
Reviews.Author: david2197
Reviews.Content: Small Hotel well located with great staff. Price included Wine & hor dourves from 5 until 6 or 6 30 and european breakfast. Tea, coffee, and even cookies are provided without charge thru-out the day and night. Decor and age of furnishing was of old french inn - not seedy but not new, etiher. Elevator was small and a "two door" model making it a little arkward with luggage. Our room was large and included a comfortable king bed w/gas firelplace. Room was on the top floor (5th) right on the street. Hotel had a noise machine in the room, no problem sleeping. Bathroom was not plush nor large but adequate. Not much room for cosmetics and things. Towels and wash cloths rather on the "thin side". Fee charged for internet and slow at that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: CAWildbill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time here. It is a beautiful little hotel with some very nice amenities. We arrived and were greeted by friendly staff. The young woman at the front desk stated, "Oh you are just in time for the wine tasting." We went downstairs and were shown an excellent selection of white and red wine with accompanying cheeses, fruits, and lemon cake. All compliments of the house. We had some great conversations with the other guests. Vallet parking was $32. It was well worth it. The rooms are small but clean. We enjoyed the free wi-fi. The showers are also quite small, just big enough to move around in. It is San Francisco after all and we paid only $200 a night. The hotel is beautifully decorated. The next morning we were treated to a delicious complimentary breakfast. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very cute boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coloradofamily7158
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable and the gas fireplace was a nice touch in chilly San Francisco. The evening cocktails and appetizers were also a nice surprise. My only recommendation is to request a room on the upper floors. I stayed on the first floor and it started to get noisy pretty early in the morning due to hearing the guests above me. Good location within walking distance of mass transit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place,Great Location,Great service and wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: brentandcarole
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed there for four days last week and we can't say enough about this place. Staff (extended family now:)) were amazingly friendly and so helpful with direction,conversation,etc. The great Breakfasts got you off to a great start in the mornings ,warm cookies throughout the day ,and the nightly wine reception gave you an opportunity to meet great people(Stewart and Lise from Liverpool,young cute couple from London,and another couple who have returned quite a few times (their Honeymoon was there some years ago!) to mention a few). We are already talking about a return trip to San Francisco in the not-too-distant future and I can assure you we will make are trip arrangement around you availability. Thank you.. Take care...Brent &Carole

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in this beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: AJoe66
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our trip to SF and this small but charming "Petite Auberge" was "La cerise sur le sundae". We appreciated the comfort but also the opportunity they give to guests to meet every night around hors-d'oeuvre and wine. Breakfasts were also another moment where we can discuss with others. The location is very good too. Not far from Union Square and from Nob Hill, a very good place to take some walks. Cable cars are not far either. I surely recommend it for people who like to meet others. We'll probably return there when we'll go back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyon45
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, another stay to celebrate our anniversary. We have stayed many places in San Francisco, everything from motels to high rise hotels, but this is our favorite. Only 26 rooms, this time we stayed in a queen, with a fireplace. It is somewhat small, but well decorated and layed out. We requested a room on the top floor (5th), which helped with the city noises. The mattress was a little soft for our liking. We especially enjoy the morning breakfast and afternoon wine and snacks. The location is great, close to everything you want to visit. Our only complaint is the nearly $40 charge for parking per day, if you don't have to bring the car, leave it at home. They also have a 20% discount if you book 30 days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Lacking - Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SFFan21
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel has the potential to be great, however, it currently seems tired and worn out. Although the location is good, the condition of my room and bath, the amenities, etc. were sub-par. The online pictures definitely look better than the real thing. Weekday breakfast was pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: metroman48
Reviews.Content: As others have said a very nice hotel located centrally enough to walk to everything or transportation to anything you might want. A nice Breakfast and descent wine reception in the evening. The noise level was not too much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back here”
Reviews.Author: tps123
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel seems to be a nice cozy french themed hotel but the walls are extremely thin and you can hear everything through the walls. The floors are creaky and you can hear people walking all night long. You can also hear the elevator go up and down and people walking up and down the stairs. You can even hear conversations through the walls. Do not stay here if you expect to get a decent night's sleep. I had a very busy day and was exhausted. Did not want to stay a second night but couldn't find availability at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Belle Auberge!”
Reviews.Author: AlieCulsh
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Petite Auberge after a flight and two train rides in coach class spanning 3 days from NYC via Chicago and L.A. On arrival we were fatigued but delighted by a warm welcome, a comfortable and clean room with a luxurious bed. The breakfast buffet was excellent and varied on each of the three mornings. Tasteful decor with a different helping of biscuits/ cake in the foyer each evening after a days walking round the city. We were able to store our luggage after check out until our evening flight. The hotel is ideally situated, the staff are helpful and we would gladly return on our next trip to San Francisco. Fantastic! ****

Reviews.Title: “Great central stay for a SF holiday”
Reviews.Author: triplover82
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our stay at Petite Auberge. The location was central - walking distance to Powell St, North Beach and Chinatown, as well as right off the tram line, yet without being too noisy or tourist trappy. The room was thoughtfully decorated, including a great fireplace. My boyfriend unfortunately became very ill just before we arrived in San Francisco, but he couldn't have had a better place to sleep and recover, and for me to shop and catch up with college friends. I would suggest trying for a top floor room as the old building carries noise.

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: vivacoloniaja
Reviews.Content: We found this great little hotel perfect for our needs: well located in walking distance to Union Square, complimentary wifi and a great breakfast. The staff was super friendly and the hotel has lots of character. Our room for instance had a little fire place.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: muffinbutton
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room with a fireplace at the far end of the third floor. Compared to other similar priced hotels, I think the Petite Auberge offers superb value for money. The room was a generous size, and the big windows filled the room with light. Plenty to eat at breakfast, and the afternoon nibbles were a real treat. That's what makes this hotel special is the little touches like that that you don't see in other places (or maybe you do if you're paying a much higher rate!). Didn't notice any road noise, but did hear the people upstairs moving around. Wasn't a big problem for us though. I think our only grumble was the unhappy lady running the breakfasts. She seemed to tut at things being eaten and used up! Great location - we like to walk everywhere so lots of the key areas of SF are accessible from the hotel. Although SF is a fantastic city, staying here made our trip even more special. It's not a faceless big hotel in a touristy area. Even with the Frech decor it feels genuine and friendly. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: the_mad_planner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two days of our honeymoon, and didn't know what to expect. We were so happy to walk in to our spacious corner room with a sitting area and gas fireplace. The bed was extremely comfortable also. Bathroom was lovely and very up to date with plenty of space. It is VERY french country- so be warned. They are not kidding about that. Breakfast was wonderful, as well, along with the tea and coffee 24 hours. They also did a little wine hour each evening, which we didn't attend much, but others certainly did. The location was terrific with Union Square and Chinatown only blocks away. And great restaurants are nearby. The only negative was that there was no one to help you get a cab if you need one. However, cabs were constantly whizzing by, so we never had much problem getting one ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Warm and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RoboPop
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the past for business and this was the first time with my spouse and grown children. Each couple had a large room with fireplace. As always, the staff is friendly and helpful. A robust breakfast is included as well as an afternoon wine tasting. We were three couples and we all agreed that this is one of San Francisco's best kept secrets. It offers a French atmosphere, tastefully done, and with a little romance included. If you would like a slice of old-world europe added to your San Francisco stay, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful petit hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shoshima
Reviews.Content: Charming, kind of an Inn hotel, like home away from home. We got a nice room at the end of the corridor on the ground floor, which was very quiet and lovely, with fireplace. Staff was so kind and helped us with everything we needed. Every day they offered a different kind of home made cake or cookies, at 18:00 - hot and cold drinks, wine.. If we will ever come back to SF, this is the place for us. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful! A Very Enjoyable Experience.”
Reviews.Author: DaveandMatsy
Reviews.Content: This being our first visit to San Francisco my wife and I didn't know what to expect when we entered the lobby of this quaint and historic appearing hotel. What a pleasant surprise to be welcomed by friendly and helpful staff. Our room on the 3rd floor was very small with a view of the brick wall of the adjoining building but nicely furnished and in fact very cozy with a feeling of warmth. For the price we were not disappointed. The location was ideal for our exploration of the city, being close to the cable cars line and other modes of public transit. There were plenty of restaurants in all price ranges and ethnic food varieties within easy walking distance to sample. The quality of the food and many choices available at the included breakfasts were especially welcomed to start our day. The menu is varied and the quality and quantity of the food is excellent.. The cosy and warm fireplace area used for the wine social and morning coffee is very pleasant. The afternoon wine socials were very enjoyable with a generous amount of high quality California wine available. We thoroughly enjoyed these social times with the other guests. All in all we have no regrets with choosing this hotel and will always cherish with fondness the French ambiance reminiscent of our hotel experiences in Paris in years past. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of France in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: tshaffer
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt as if we were in the south of France. Quaint, not Westin/Marriot. Cozy rooms with fireplaces. Common area with daily wine and appetizers, very comfortable for meeting other guest. Didn't feel as if you were in a hotel,more like a home. Two blocks from Powell Street (cable cars) and 5 minute walk to Union Square or Chinatown. 10 minute walk to Powell BART station. One of the best breakfasts we've had in a hotel in the U.S. p.s. Don't buy tour bus tickets from street ticket booths. Go directly to whatever tour bus you want to go on.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to SF”
Reviews.Author: KeriandScott
Reviews.Content: Arriving into SFO Airport we took the BART train to the Powell St. station. We then hopped a cab to take us to the Petit Auberge. Upon first sight the hotel looked great and fit the part of a French inn. We checked in at the neighboring sister hotel and made our way to our room. The old style elevator was a surprise to us and added to the appeal. We were upgraded to a room with a fireplace that we were thankful for on a couple of the days after being out in the wind. The room was clean and cozy. Walking around the room we noticed the creaky floors. Later that night our neighbors on the floor above were walking around and we heard every step. Breakfast was spot on, sausage, quiche, fruit, breakfast breads, eggs and plenty of good coffee. One benefit we thought that wasn't that big of a deal that turned out to be a really big deal was the free sodas and water in the fridge. We really came to appreciate this. Overall this hotel was a great value for us and a nice retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Different - but in a good way, a very good way”
Reviews.Author: nealwBoston
Reviews.Content: After staying in some of the larger hotels in San Francisco on various business trips over the years, including Hotel Monaco, Fairmont Nob Hill and Hotel Nikko (all of which were excellent in their own right) I went for ``boutique'' this time around and was pleasantly surprised. Petite Auberge has many quirky aspects to it, all of which I enjoyed. For example, you need a key to open the front door. That's different. The elevator has those cool grated doors that you slide open before entering or exiting. You can always sneak down to a cooler near the kitchen and grab a Coke, free. If you're looking for a grand lobby, this place is not for you. There pretty much isn't a lobby and most of the time I was there, there didn't seem to be anybody at the front desk. So, if you're looking for a super-attentive concierge service, this isn't your place. But it has a wonderful homey kind of vibe that grows on you. I'm not a big breakfast guy, but where else can you get quiche, sausages, baked French toast, amazing little pastries, a do-it-yourself oatmeal station with fruit and nuts and grains and stuff, great coffee, a toaster, jams and jellies. The breakfast room in the lower level is homey and small, so everybody is friendly and makes conversion, which is a great way to get tips on where to do and what to do. One couple that I met had been coming to Petite Auberge every year for 25 years, It's that kind of place. There's an afternoon wine and cheese reception in a small living room area, which also has the same friendly feel. The room was relatively small, but comfortable. Everything worked. Free Internet. Again, if you're looking for a USA Today under your door every morning and a gift shop and room service meals, this is not your place. But, hey, you're in San Franciso, where everything is just outside your doorstep. Petite Auberge is a great sanctuary and an alternative to the Hiltons of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Alf_Bacon
Reviews.Content: Small and cosy hotel, we both loved the quiet and easy going style. Excellent breakfast and very good afternoon hors d'oevre (hope that is spelled correctly...). Close to Market Street and the cable car, very well positioned. Accomodating and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Generous breakfast, homey fireplaces”
Reviews.Author: SMD47
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking the City. Very generous and delicious breakfasts included. The staff, especially Andy, were pleasant and responsive. We stayed in room #31 overlooking Bush street. The room has a king bed, fireplace and a windowseat, very romantic. Bathroom is small be adequate.

Reviews.Title: “They keep me coming back”
Reviews.Author: Boston_T_Party
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the PA once before, as well as its sister Inn, the Black Swan. This is a place that keeps me coming back for the price. The people that work there are really helpful. Andy, one of the assistant managers, provided a lot of useful information and was very helpful to us when we checked in. He gave us advice on avoiding parking tickets in the restricted zones near the hotel and told us where to save $$ on parking. He helped us to find a room we liked. We appreciate the very nice breakfast experience at PA, that makes a relaxing and nutritious start to the day. Quiche, croissants, wonderful bread, great coffee, fresh fruit, etc. etc. The chef, Joel, did a great job every day. The eating area at PA is a bit small, but if you want more room (when there are a lot of people at breakfast) you can pop over next door and have breakfast at the Black Swan. In general, PA is the smaller hotel of the two places, and I think the rooms in PA are smaller than at the Black Swan. Get a room with a fireplace. A little more $ but more room. We were there in January and the fireplace added to the ambience. I like the location of the PA, but you have to do hills to get around from the hotel. This is SF after all! But its near Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown, Financial District. We used ZipCar during our stay and there were three or four sites within a couple blocks. My wife and I like the cozy charm of this French-themed boutique hotel (although I can do without the piped in Edith Piaf type of music in the common areas). It has a homey feel. If you are into the upscale hotel experience, this is not your thing. But PA has sufficiently good infrastructure and friendly helpful staff to create a comfort zone for new visitors and returnees like us. The additional amenities, free local paper, fresh baked cookies every day, wine and appetizers each night, are icing on the cake because they pull off the rest of the hotel experience well.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful escape in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: markroy53
Reviews.Content: this was the fourth joie de vivre property we stayed in during our honeymoon in california. each property is completely different and each has its own charm. we had a slight problem with our luggage here, probably a communication issue, but after around two hours it was delivered as well as a complimentary bottle of wine. the rooms r charming and ours had a fireplace which was certainly needed in the cold san francisco weather. it is conveniently located and within walking and public transportation access.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petite Auberge as a stopover on our way to Hawaii. We wanted a reasonable hotel in a central location as we had just one full day in San Fran. It was an easy taxi ride from the airport and it cost about the same as a shared shuttle; we passed on mass transport as you need to climb the hills with your luggage. We had to go to the adjoining hotel for check in; apparently it is a slower season and occupancy was low. Despite the redirection, our registration was friendly, quick and efficient. Our room was on the 5th floor ,(the lobby is on the 2nd) accesible by a antique, but efficient ,elevator complete with an accordian metal door. The decor of our large room was bright with antique eclectic furniture. The bathroom was clean and functional. We selected a room with a fireplace and it was our main warmth on a cold SF evening. The room was very clean although slightly showing wear. The bed was very comfortable and the linens high quality. Our location was perfect, Bush street, as we were a cable car from the Warf and a few blocks from Chinatown. Breakfast was included in our price and it was very good. fresh fruits, pastries, juice, coffee and home made quiche. For less tha $150 a night it was a good choice, and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “a cosy downtown winter experience”
Reviews.Author: Whiskie8
Reviews.Content: one night overnight stay at end of a business trip. delightful to stay in a cosy more personal hotel (more like a pension) - rather than a big hotel. extremely central location that was half the price of 4 star hotels only 2 blocks away! i think this place would better suit personal travellers - only downsides as a business traveller were the juggle with the luggage (although porter was most prompt and helpful). check in and check out were in sister premises next door. room had poor lighting, no airconditioning (only a fireplace heater. good for winter but dont know about summer). there was no desk in the room - a challenge as a business traveller. also the TV in the cupboard was small and not possible to view from the bed (room 24). the hotel's wireless internet router was faulty - so very limited access. complimentary light evening drinks and nibbles and continental style breakfast in the morning were inkeeping with the personality of the premises. very friendly and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “A French Country Bed and Breakfast in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: shayzied
Reviews.Content: As is our recent tradition for the day after Thanksgiving, we, along with some goofy friends of ours, meet in San Francisco the Friday after Turkey-Day. This year, I decided not to stay directly on Union Square but 2 blocks above at a small Bed and Breakfast inn, "Petite Auberge." We really enjoyed Petite Auberge. The staff was composed of the most friendly people I've ever met in San Francisco. They couldn't do enough to ensure that we were happy with our accommodations and our stay with them. We stayed in the Queen Room with fireplace, and because the weather was unseasonably cold and damp for this time of year, we made very good use of the fireplace! Read more: http://shaydavidsonsblog.blogspot.com/2010/12/new-sf-restaurant-and-very-sweet-sf-b.html

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TouristeSeattle
Reviews.Content: Our family (using 4 different rooms) gathered at Petit Auberge for a gathering and sight-seeing in San Francisco. The excellent staff of Petit Auberge sincerely and thoughtfully try to help with every need of each guest; all eight of us felt incredibly welcome and had multiple pleasant interactions with front desk staff and room attendants. Prior to our arrival, a couple of us called the hotel with questions that were thoroughly answered with genuine enthusiasm. Without a doubt, the staff elevate this hotel to an exceptional level as a warm, friendly place to stay in a large city. The hotel's location is superb. We walked to Chinatown in 10 minutes, had easy access to cable cars and, when necessary, used taxis. Because our group was big, hotel staff would arrange for a couple of taxis to pick us up but for a smaller group, a single taxi would be easily hailed. Rooms are bright, cheery and very French in decor, and each of ours had a gas fireplace. Rooms varied in noise level; Rooms 46 and 26 were at the back of the hotel and faced a quieter street than Room 41 which faced Bush Street and had moderate street noise throughout the night. All of us heard some noise from rooms above, but very similar to what's heard in a European B & B. Room 41 is a Deluxe King, with a pull out single twin bed. All rooms were very clean and serviced promptly each day. Free internet access in our room was excellent. In addition to the rooms, the hotel has other pleasant features. Since we had a large group, we found the downstairs gathering room with a fireplace perfect for breakfast, the wine reception, and just getting together. There was a community fridge stocked with complimentary sodas and bottled waters. The tasty breakfast was consistently croissants and assorted pastries, quiche, oatmeal, dry cereal, toast, sliced fruit, sausages with hot beverages and juices. The hotel recommended three restaurants: Sam's Grill (10 - 15 minute walk), L'Ottavo (5 minute walk), and House of NanKing (15 - 20 minute walk). Our group uniformly enjoyed each of these restaurants. Last, price was excellent for San Francisco - the most expensive room was the Deluxe King at ~ $150 weekdays and ~$170 weekends, booked directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome deal”
Reviews.Author: BC-7
Reviews.Content: This place is really great, and is a screaming deal for San Francisco. It was really nice that breakfast was included, there was always free coffee, tea, and bottled water and soda available (yes, free), and the wine and cheese, etc. they set out in the afternoon is really excellent. Did I mention the free newspapers in the morning, and the free wifi in the rooms? This is an old building, and it's a little rough around the edges, but it had great character. I felt like I was staying in my Auntie Jeanne's house in the French countryside. Aunt Jeanne's getting on in years, and useless cousin Marco isn't doing enough to keep up with the maintenance on the property -- there were a couple of spots where the ceiling paint was peeling, the wooden floor squeaked a bit, and the windows could really use a wash. But the gas fireplace in my room worked great, the shower was one of the best I've had in my life, and this was nothing like the typical cookie-cutter hotel room that's so boring.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in spite of some flaws.”
Reviews.Author: WendyNYRochester
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend. Overall, we were very pleased. The location could not be better (you do need to become adjusted to city noise if you are a country dweller) and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast and afternoon wine / snack gathering was wonderful. We had requested a larger, top floor corner room, away from the elevator. This request was partially granted based on availability. Our room was large, with a nice view. Our only concern was that the lobby area and our room especially (located above the lobby) had a distinct foul smell. My husband thought it was a musty / mold smell. I tend to have a very good sense of smell and the smell to me was urine...perhaps someone had an untrained pet? This smell lasted our entire 4 days. Since staff opened windows in the hallways and in our room consistently, I think they knew about the smell. The hotel is very old, needs some up-grades (e.g. unpatched holes in walls) but overall is excellent for the price, in our opinion. Our room did not have a TV but we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Joan2355
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located for anything you want to do in San Francisco. The staff are helpful and the room was perfect. After a day of sighseeing we would come back and freshen up go downstairs sip some wine and chat with people from all over the world. The room was clean and quiet. If you are unsure just ask they are very helpful and can make arrangements or reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Petite Auberge”
Reviews.Author: manoross
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petite Auberge at the start and end of our Tour of the West Coast. The hotel is well located in San Francisco and not too far for either the cable car to Downtown or Fishermans Wharf. Our first room was an upgrade to one with a fireplace. The room is slightly larger than our second room which was bijou but both were very comfortable and the ensuites did the job. The afternoon wine and eats was a great way to meet fellow travellers.I'd be happy to stay here again,which is recommendation enough.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a good friend's home”
Reviews.Author: bobandlaura99
Reviews.Content: Petite Auberge was a delightful surprise, from the hospitality to the food and location we will be staying here again when visiting San Francisco! The breakfast was a wonderful array of homemade food which varried everyday. Something for everyone, fresh fruit, eggs, potates, pasteries, ect. The afternoon wine time was my favorite! Everyone gets together to talk about their day and enjoy good wine and cheese, homemade cakes, pizza, lasagna,and spreads before heading out to dinner. The staff and fellow guests made it a memorable experience. Rooms are small but cozy and clean. Stay on the top floor if your a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “atmosphere of a bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: willy0228
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time at this hotel while in town for the Nike Women's Marathon. The hotel did not feel like a hotel as the atmosphere was more of a comfortable bed and breakfast with guests joining together at the complimentary breakfast in the morning and for wine and snacks in the early evening. The breakfast was filling with plenty to eat from sourdough toast with jam to quiche and fresh cut up fruit and yogurt. There was an open fridge with complimentary water and sodas as well as a cookie jar in the entryway. The charm of this hotel was its small size and friendly staff and guests. Our room came with a fireplace ( some don't) which was my favorite part of the room. It certainly helped dry our wet clothes after spending the day watching/running the marathon in the rain. The hotel was a great starting point for our daily adventures as it was just a couple of blocks from the Powell Bart station, the Powell cable cars and Union Square. I also want to mention that although breakfast began at 8:00 am on weekends they were very accommodating by putting out a special breakfast of bagels in the morning for those guests leaving at 6:00 am for the marathon. Thanks Petite Auberge!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: vanguard22
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here because we were running in the marathon. The breakfast was delicious, the wine reception wonderful--not just cold foods served---and the room was clean and comfortable. Service was terrific--from the front desk to the people helping at the breakfast and wine reception. We were also able to keep our bags at the hotel after checking out to pick up later, and that was very helpful. Highly recommend this hotel, and look forward to returning with my husband for a romantic visit!

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastGirl60
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in San Francisco and had picked Petite Auberge from some on line reviews. What a find!! Great location, wonderful breakfasts, evening receptions, you just met the nicest people and the friendliest staff. We would not hesitate to come back to Petite Auberge.

Reviews.Title: “a nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: kateandtokyo
Reviews.Content: We decided to go back to San Fran earlier on our trip as we enjoyed it so much and had not yet booked accomdation so found this in our lonely planet guide and decided to stay on the location to everything and the breakfast and wine reception. On arrival after a long journey, I was quite dissapointed as it didnt meet my expectations from previous hotels. The rooms are quite old and chinzey and have a fire instead or air con which was quite wierd. But once we had a few glasses of wine and nibbles down stairs, we grew to like the hotel even more! It was clean and friendly with good service but we could have done with AC as I didnt sleep too well. The homemade breakfast was good and had plenty of choice including lots of frexh fruit and healthy options, which really saved us some money at the end of the trip. Guests also have unlimited access to free hot drinks, bottled water and sodas in the fridge downstairs which was very welcoming. A nice mix of guests, although we seemed to be younger than the average guest, so maybe a better hotel for a more mature traveller. Great location near to Union Square, China Town and Little Italy. Give it a try, you may get a nice suprise!

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of our San Francisco stay”
Reviews.Author: turner55_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived to wet ,dismal weather in San Francisco and Petite Auberge was welcoming and cosy. We loved the 5:00 drinks and chat with other guests every night especially as it was around the fireplace. The hotel was generous with nibbles and wine. Our room was also welcoming with pleasant decor and a fire. It isn't extremely large but we didn't think that important. Our room was quiet. The breakfasts were OK but it is wise to arrive early or you will get a limited choice. I don't know if the hotel would be as good an experience in hot weather but I would recommend it as a great stay in winter and early spring.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Petite Auberge”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLea
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous little country inn right in the heart of the city. The breakfast buffet was excellent but the highlight of our stay was the afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres served in the lounge. It was a great way to meet other travellers and find out what everyone else was doing and seeing in San Francisco. We all shared stories and recommendations for dinner. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The hotel is centrally located right near the two cable car routes on Powell St. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort without the paraphernalia of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sue_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: A delightful hotel. Echoes of France with our quite small room size and the decorations throughout the Auberge. Everything very good indeed, from the staff on reception, the wifi connection through to the quality of the bed linen and towels. Super breakfast. Particularly enjoyed the evening drinks/appetisers with the other guests where you can catch up on peopleâ€™s travels. Comfortable public area with sofas and easy chairs. Loved it. This is a travellerâ€™s lodge for those who like comfort without the paraphernalia of luxury. Tips for San Francisco: buy a bus pass for $13 and cruise the bus, tram and trolley routes all day. Visit Loriâ€™s diner on Powell street for 1960s retro, juke box and full replica of a 60â€™s Ford Edsell. Need to do laundry? - there's a laundromat just a very short block down.

Reviews.Title: “the Best Hotel in the World I think”
Reviews.Author: AnnaElisabeth81
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at Petite Auberge for one week in July and it was the best hotel we have ever been to! It is FANTASTIC! The staff is helpful, professional and friendly and you feel very welcome. In the lobby there are a box of freshly home made pastries every afternoon! Perfect after before going to bed. The breakfast is fantastic, with many choices and everything is home made I think! There are fresh fruit, juice, porridge, wheat meal, bread, croissants and more.. We enjoyed the breakfast every morning! And in the afternoon it's time for free wine and some snack. It's different kinds of snack every day, one day the staff had made some delicious salad and salty bisquits with different kinds of cheese and pesto. It was also a nice opportunity to have a chat with the other guests since the wine is served downstairs in the "Livingroom" in front of the fireplace. The room was clean and the bed was really comfy! I slept like a baby every night. The interior makes you feel like you are in France in the 1930s! This is the most romantic hotel we have ever been to! It made our stay in San Francisco perfect! We love the staff that was the nicest people I have ever met!

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster”
Reviews.Author: cyclegirl33
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel,first off the doors were locked,the hotel doesn't look like the internet at all.There is no air condition,they would bring you up a fan if you need it.No screens on the windows.The bathroom is even worse,old dirty,all the windows are dirty.We left we didn't even stay there.The area outside has many people begging for money,we even saw a woman sitting on the side walk holding a rat.Just avoid the down town area of San Francisco all together or go to a well known hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot, but with all this area has to offer, don't limit your search”
Reviews.Author: pegpaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Petite Auberge for two nights while visiting San Francisco to celebrate our second anniversary. The location is very good, walking distance near cable cars and a multitude of restaurants. We checked our bags early at the sister hotel, White Swan, and the staff there was just delightful in welcoming us. We were disappointed in our room experience; my husband had asked for a room that was away from the street noise, but as it turns out we were placed in a room very near Sutter Street, which had a bar on it that was very, very noisy when patrons stumbled onto the street in the wee hours of the morning. Also, the room that we were in had a horridly-loud vibrating noise emanating from the bathroom ceiling light, at times it seemed louder than the street noise! Breakfasts were quite yummy with lots to choose from; the breakfast serving room at Petite Auberge is quite cramped and the staff on duty at the time was quite slow in busing tables; we had to do some of this ourselves to find a spot to eat. Although they served the same items at both Petite and White Swan, the breakfast experience at White Swan was definitely better, roomier and more relaxed. Apparently the front desk at Petite is not staffed after a particular hour in the afternoon, which can leave you feeling a little stranded. A future suggestion for a nice touch would be to make more newspapers available to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of perks, lackluster service.”
Reviews.Author: andrea6928
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the location, free hot breakfast and wi-fi (and the 20% off coupon code I found online). TIP: There's almost never anyone at the Petite Auberge front desk, so go to the White Swan next door to check in. They tell you this in your confirmation e-mail. There's also a sign outside to direct you. I booked a cozy queen, but they upgraded us to a deluxe for free! More space and a fireplace! I'm glad about that; the cozy queens are VERY small. If you want space, go to a Marriott. As far as I could tell, there was no A/C, but we didn't need it. We had the windows open every night and were very comfortable. Fair warning to light sleepers, it does get noisy outside at night (it's a city after all), but the front desk provides free earplugs if you need them. Location can't be beat. We were told to head down the block to Walgreens to buy a 3-day muni pass, but you really don't need to. It's so close to everything, just walk! Seriously, it's 5 minutes to Union Square, 10 minutes to Chinatown, 20 minutes to the piers. WALK. Breakfast was incredible each morning! My favorite was the French toast bake. The fruit was fresh, the coffee was strong. We only made it to the evening wine and hors d'oeuvres once, but what a great perk. Awesome cheeses and pastries, and the chance to meet friendly fellow tourists from all over the globe. The cookie jar in the lobby was always filled with tasty treats. The chocolate almond bars were out of this world. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel was a big plus, as I had to do homework while on vacation :( The dining area and lounge downstairs had big comfy couches, a fireplace, and a book swap. We spent a couple of nights down there reading or doing work. The only downside to our stay was the super nice, but super disorganized staff. All I wanted was an extra towel to dry my hair.
