I called, and they immediately sent one up. Then the next day, housekeeping took it away (and no, I didn't leave it in the tub like they ask you to if you want your towels changed)! I called again that night, and no one showed. It took 3 calls to the front desk over 2 days to get a freakin' towel. We were also supposed to get a complimentary bottle of wine for being a member of the Joie de Vivre loyalty club, but didn't until the last night of our stay. If I didn't call (multiple times), we probably wouldn't have gotten it at all. Towel and wine aside, I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Petite Auberge More positve than negative”
Reviews.Author: amrdia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over Labor Day weekend. I found the location decent, not the best or worst. Short walks to Chinatown and Union Square. We upgraded to a petite suite. Worth the money. Fireplace, private deck etc. I realize it is old but musty smells can be eliminated. The staff was friendly with the exception of the Asian breakfast lady. She was quite grumpy on both days. The breakfast was nothing to write home about. The 2nd day the hot food was out for twenty minutes and a shortage of clean forks. Maybe it wqas the holiday weekend. Kevin at the White Swan (the sister property next door) was very helpful. He helped me select a nearby Italian eatery in the Andrews Hotel called Fino....I highly reccommend! Overall, lower your expectations.... I too took Tripadvisor guidance as I usually do...but, the reviews were more generous than accurate. I would stay here again....but also consider other properties. Anther positive was WIFI included in your rate.

Reviews.Title: “meh.”
Reviews.Author: bigfernie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our trip to San Francisco based on trip advisor reviews which were generally positive, and was particularly swayed by user's comments mentioning the hotel's charm, excellent location, friendly staff and free, tasty breakfast amongst other things. The price was a little high but I figured would be worth it for comfort and a charming stay. We were there for five nights and I am afraid to say I can only give this hotel an "average" rating for the following reasons: Teeny tiny rooms: They say they are "cozy" which is a nice euphemism for cramped. I realize that many of the older hotels in San Fran are like this, and it can be part of the charm, but please be warned if booking online that the pictures they show of the rooms here are of the large sized rooms, not the majority which are much smaller. Ours barely had a room for a bed let alone the dresser and t.v. and the bathroom was cruise ship size at best. This would have been fine for us for a 1 or 2 night stay but after 5 nights we were itching for larger rooms and space to move around, particularly in the bathroom. View: Had a "lovely" view of the decrepit building next door (mostly window sills slathered with pigeon poop). Make sure you request room with a view, as we did not. Noise: I can't really fault the hotel for being noisy as it's San Fran, a big city, and in a noisy part of town, but almost every night around 3 a.m. I was awoken by sounds of people rolling metal tins down the alley way below the window. So be forewarned if you are at all a light sleeper, this may not be the place/location for you. Positives: The rooms were, for the most part, clean but the bathroom needs work. Ours had what looked like black mold under the wallpaper by the windows. Staff were generally friendly and polite, and the old-style lift elevator is neat. The place always smellt really nice, like lemongrass, and the appetizers/wine in the evenings is a nice touch. Breakfasts overall were always good although yes, they do serve the same basic thing everyday (quiche, hard boiled eggs, canadian bacon or sausage, oatmeal or cereal, toast, fruit (usually melon), yoghurt and cottage cheese and sometimes assorted pastries. I found there was enough variety for me (am a somewhat light eater though) and better than what you'd find at most other hotels with free breakfasts. The coffee was hit or miss (mostly miss) so be warned if you're a hardcore coffee enthusiast. Also I should mention, every morning when I went down for breakfast I found most other guests who were there eating seemed to be in grumpy moods, just eating their food solemnly and then leaving, not any lively chit chat or anything. Maybe it was the french music they had going every morning? I dunno.. Overall, I recommend this as a place for active older couples (NOT families or people who want peace and quiet) who are staying for a few days , want to mix and mingle with other travelers and experience sleeping in a historic-type of San Fran hotel, and who are not light sleepers. For a romantic getaway, or even just a quieter place to catch up on sleep after a busy day touring San Fran, there are quieter, roomier hotels down along Lombard Street (that have convenient bus access and walking distance to many of the hot spots) that may be better suited, as was our case.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and charming, with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: SeaReview
Reviews.Content: For those who appreciate European-style lodging, treasure unique experiences â€“ and want to stay in the heart of downtown SF on more of a budget (not that SF is cheap), this place is ideal. We arrived early and they were gracious about finding a room, and then helpfully showed me to another room (that did not have a view of a wall) which was fine. The easy chair, fireplace and wifi were great! It was so lovely going down to the daylight basement lounge in the morning (with chintz sofas, a little dining room and a patio , Edith Piaf music and a great home-cooked breakfast buffet and complimentary newspapers) that we never checked out the equally interesting and much larger lounge next door at the sister hotel until checking out. I was glad I could read the reviews so as to know what to expect, but the complainers should just stay in a Holiday Inn. What I didnâ€™t expect was the outstanding helpfulness of the staff. Over the top helpful. There is a market across the street, and a fantastic grocery store in the Westfield Center down the hill, also great for the budget. There seemed to be a rowdy street? bar? somewhere nearby with noise â€“ but is not hot â€“ just shut the window- itâ€™s the big city, vibrant and alive. Isn't that why we visit?

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillsMan7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of a 3 week varied trip across California. Staying in 2, 3, 4 and 5 star hotels across our trip, we visited San Fran, LA, Las Vegas, Santa Barbara, San Diego and La Jolla. This hotel was an absolute gem and a charming hotel located right in the heart of San Fran. It's pretty much in the Union Square district which was perfect for us. We also had booked tickets to go on the Golden Gate Cruise and the Alcatraz Tour. We decided to walk down to the piers and it took us about 40 minutes, with a child in a stroller. Check in was quick and easy, and the attendant was very friendly. There were cookies in the lobby, and free sodas in the kitchen. We didn't go for hors d'oevers so I can't comment on them, but we did go for the inclusive breakfast which was tasty - we had quiche (or tortillas), sausages, toast, muffins, tea and coffee. It was really nice. The room was quaint, and not too small. We had asked for a cot to be provided and this was there when we arrived. The room and building is what I would call "rustic". We live in a house that was built in the 1600s so this hotel was fine for us - we weren't looking for modern perfection. That said, the free WiFi worked well and there were no problems connecting. We would definitely recommend this hotel as a lovely getaway in the heart of San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE ROOMS - FREE WINE - WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK ?”
Reviews.Author: citygirl53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Petite having previously stayed at the White Swan Inn a week earlier . We were welcomed by the enthusiastic Andy and were able to check into our room early. Both hotels are excellent. We had been on a trip to the Monterey area and it was a bit like coming home. Our room was slightly more noisy at the weekend than our room at the White Swan as it faced the street - however this was cured by my trusty ear-plugs. Our room was very comfortable with a French style decor and an open gas fire which was very welcome in the evenings even though it was July. There was free wine and snacks in the downstairs lounge between 5pm and 6.30pm. Coffee and tea were available 24hrs. There were also free soft drinks, water and ice. We had a coffee maker in our room. The breakfast was good and varied. Overall a lovely comfortable traditional-style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the warm atmosphere and eager to stay again”
Reviews.Author: LawMom2
Reviews.Content: We're from So Cal and go to San Francisco for business. We took the Bart from SFO to Market Street, then up the hill on the trolley. So much fun. Arrived at the hotel to find a very helpful staff . We arrived early checked our bag and enjoyed the comfortable homey sitting rooms to relax in. The room had a fire place. We've found our home away from home in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: mlmcconn
Reviews.Content: We came back to stay at La Petite after staying at the Hyatt during our last visit. Nothing against the Hyatt, but La Petite is a unique experience. It's small size and friendly, helpful staff (we do, however, miss Steve at the front desk) made us feel like we were guests and not just a number. The breakfast is wonderful, the rooms are comfortable and well-sized & the location is awesome. When we return to the city, we will be returning to La Petite Auberge also

Reviews.Title: “We felt pampered and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: njs1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Petite Auberge was exceptional. It had the atmosphere of a small inn or bed and breakfast. We especially enjoyed the "happy hour". We found it was a good way to meet fellow travelers and relax before going out for the evening. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The location was convenient to Union Square. A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, warm, hospitality in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mamalumpy
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, very nice breakfast & afternoon snacks-we will return to Petite Auberge when we return to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Goldia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the location and breakfast at Petite Auberge. The service was attentive and helpful. And it was so close to Union Square. We had a quiet room with a fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “A rare gem”
Reviews.Author: macrabbit
Reviews.Content: We were here four nights. The location for the price is excellent; so close to the cable car lines and Union Square. Breakfasts are well prepared, with many choices, in a pleasant room. The wine/hors d'ouevres hour exceeds others we have experienced. Our in-room fireplace was a bit loud, but such a nice touch. This is an older hotel, with some squeaky floors and a cobweb here and there, but it beats anything you would find in Paris for twice the price. You'll meet many lovely European tourists here, which is fun, too.

Reviews.Title: “Golden stay in Golden Gate city”
Reviews.Author: Razzypop
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had the good fortune of being guests at Petite Auberge for 4 days at the end of May. It was charmed from the very first minute we arrived. the welcome was warmer than even the fireplace in our room. To absolutely everyone at this wonderful B&B, we want to say a super thank you. To Chris and all the incredibly helpful staff at reception, at breakfast, and those we just happened to encounter around the hotel, you made san francisco that more amazing. we loved everything. the location, the rooms, the friendly smiles from people who clearly love what they do, the warm fire on a cold night and the cookie jar filled with treats. If ever i visit san francisco again, this will be where i hang my hat. Razia & Fatima

Reviews.Title: “On a rainy afternoon, we sat by the fire, sipping wine and listening to music”
Reviews.Author: Amaryllisum
Reviews.Content: This B&B was like being in France, except the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast, of course, was not up to French standards, but OK. Bed was excellent, there was a gas fireplace, a CD player, we had a kitchenette with empty fridge, sink, coffee maker; large bath with toilet in separate closet, french doors and a window overlooking our balcony, which had an umbrella table and chairs and plenty of blooming pots of plants. Delightful! Good location, half way down Nob Hill. Since we like to fill up the fridge with fresh berries for breakfast, we were pleased to find numerous small groceries within a block or less, and the bellman suggested a really excellent restaurant in China Town for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “inviting guest house experience”
Reviews.Author: gaf14
Reviews.Content: nice and cozy rooms with French styling and flair. Good breakfast and evening snacks with wine. More like a bed and breakfast than a city hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTraveler002
Reviews.Content: Pros - Great value - Great location - Yummy breakfast, wine and cheese, water and soft drinks (all included) - Friendly and knowledgeable staff - Wireless internet included - Great ambiance Cons - A little noisy (but they provide a sound machine!) - We had a small room with a very small shower, but cozy

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: livininbigD
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Petite Auberge. Great location-access to public transportation and easy walk to Chinatown. It was fun visiting with other travelers during the wine get-togethers in the early evening. Room was great, very cozy with the fireplace. Staff very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephanie60
Reviews.Content: Visited San Francisco with my daughter and granddaughter for a girls weekend of fun and shopping. After looking at reviews on Trip Adivisor chose the Petite Auberge over its sister hotel the White Swan for the French ambience. Happy to say the PA lived up to its internet hype completely. We stayed in the deluxe King room 41 in the front which included a king bed, sofa bed, desk and wingback chair. The gas fireplace and window seat added to the charming decor. The only problem was I did hear the people on the floor above walking around very late which did disturb me and the street noise was a bit loud on Monday morning but not at all over the weekend. I would recommend that you request a top floor room and if a queen at the very back of the hotel. The breakfast was truly great--the best I have ever had at a hotel. One day it was scrambled eggs, quiche, various pastries, cereal, yogurt and fruit, biscuits, and juice. Another included quiche, sausage patties and all of the above. The afternoon wine reception was excellent--not the ususal crackers and cheese but included brownies, crackers and cheese dips, deviled eggs, a salad and more. Served in the cozy little lounge downstairs with the fireplace glowing and friendly guests to chat with, it was a really nice experience. Also, left out until very late and we ended up spending an entire evening sipping wine and eating the goodies. The lack of a reception person at the desk at all times was a little inconvenient, but it was easy enough to go next door to the White Swan if you needed anything. They also kept our luggage for us after we checked out until we headed for the airport. The promised Golden Gate Volunteer guide did not happen which was a disappointment. Apparantly they need at least a week to arrange for the volunteer which I thought was a little odd since it is supposed to be an ongoing program. Would probably be better not to offer it at all than to have no follow through on providing the service. All in all a great experience and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing place, outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: arp315
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Francisco, so I was unsure where to stay. After an internet search I came across the Petite Auberge. It was perfect for my needs, clean, safe, and close to everything. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the breakfast way above the norm that you get in regular hotels. I was really blown away by how nice the whole place was. I would without a doubt return, and I am already planning it. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and have everything you need for a great stay. You won't be disappointed! (The afternoon reception is a nice touch also). Really well done.

Reviews.Title: “great place but not quiet”
Reviews.Author: beaches1968
Reviews.Content: my my mom booked this hotel for me and my friend for our senior class trip. great place but be prepared for a small room. Most important get a room away from the streets. it was veryyyyyyy noisy.

Reviews.Title: “European Ambience in SF for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: 2travelersfromCT
Reviews.Content: If you want a bit of European ambience during your stay in SF, stay at the Petite Auberge Hotel. It is nicely located on Bush St, in or near Nob Hill. We walked to Japantown easily. The staff was helpful, we loved our room with gas fireplace and there is an elevator that will remind you of the small hotels in France. The afternoon wine reception is a very nice touch, with cheese & crackers, fruit and cake and plenty of wine to go around; and the breakfast was great. All at an amazing price!

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what a perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Havecakewilltravel
Reviews.Content: Came into the city to see a show and needed a place to stay overnight to avoid a late night trip back to the suburbs. Found Petite Auberge online and thought, "Well, it looks nice online, but we'll see how that works out!" Was thrilled to find that PA is just as charming as it looks on the website. My sister and I stayed in room 51 on the top floor, a deluxe king with fireplace. Here's what we loved: top floor and no adjoining rooms, which meant no noise from other guests; large, comfortable bed with bed tables on both sides, reading lamps with enough light for reading (!); fireplace which came on with a flick of a switch (and yes, gas fires are just as cozy as wood ones when you're tired and ready for bed); comfy couch in front of said fire; writing desk; One entire wall of windows looking out onto Bush Street, with window seat no less); windows that open to let in the breeze; a heater that is, wait for it, easy to turn on and off; and that's just the room. Breakfast was included in the cost of the room, was delicious, and served in an adorable and quaint breakfast room next to a parlor with comfy couches in front of another fireplace, and a couple of cozy reading nooks. There is also a space to sit outside, weather permitting, that is quite charming. Staff? All competent, all friendly, all ready to help, with a smile. If this sounds too good to be true, go stay there and see for yourself. Also, the location couldn't be better. The show we saw was on Nob Hill (three blocks); the restaurant where we had dinner just off Union Square (three blocks), and once we parked the car (yes, they valet) we didn't have to think about it again until we left. Will stay here again in a heartbeat. i should mention that there is a bit of street noise, but I wasn't bothered by it. In fact, I slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mojobaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a room with a fireplace and the gourmet breakfast is fantastic. This is our second stay at this hotel and stay again next time we go to San Francisco. The wine reception in the evening is also very nice. The furniture is a bit dated but you can't complain for the value. The cable car and bus lines are only a block away and it is easy to get anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a little European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: mylanina
Reviews.Content: I come to SF area, (Marin) often and usually stay with family. Because of a special event in the city proper, I took a room, alone, without spouse, which is a rather unique experience. I had the most delightful stay, and wanted to add a few nights, but couldn't. The reception was lovely, the colors, furniture and wallpapers of Province immerse you in another world. The wine and hors d'oeuvres every evening, Tea and coffe through out the day, extraordinary full breakfast with newspapers and sitting room or dining room overlooking the garden are just charming. A fireplace in the bedroom capped off the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: Petite Auberge is convenient to events at the Masonic Auditorium (although you have to climb a steep hill). It's a good place to stay if you prefer bed and breakfasts to hotels. It's in a mixed residential and commercial neighborhood that has lots of interesting restaurants. We got a rate of $139 which was better than we could have gotten at one of the Nob Hill hotels, and it included breakfast, wine hour and no resort fee. It is charming and well maintained, although a little fussy for our taste. One thing we did like that we generally don't see at bed and breakfasts was a TV in the room. We like to watch the news as we are getting dressed and miss it when we don't have a TV at similar properties. There is also a nice little pocket garden on the property where you can have coffee or breakfast when the weather allows. Although we enjoyed our stay, I have to admit that I am quite mystified about Conde Nast voting this a top 75 hotel in the US. We thought it was fine, but we have stayed at lots of places in the US that we thought were nicer. Either we don't understand the rules of the Conde Nast award or we missed something during our stay. That said, we would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotta5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find we had been upgraded to the Petite Suite, since I am a Joy of Life club member. What a cute suite totally secluded from the hotel with it's own private entrance and patio! Very nice! Breakfast was delicious and filling and wine/snack hour was great as well. Not to mention soda, coffee, water and tea 24 hours complimentary! Really saved some extra cash there:) We were in walking distance to see Wicked, which was one of the reasons for our visits. The hotel is in a great location to Union Square, shopping, food and night life. We will definitely stay at this hotel again, we had a great experiance!

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: MaresEatOats2
Reviews.Content: When you visit San francisco, you must stay at Petite Auberge. It iis a charming B&B in a great location with wonderful staff. The brreakfasts were wonderful with many choices to fill up on. We liked the pastries with fruit. And why not enjoy wine and hors d'ourves in the evening, on the house. Our room has a fireplace which is both romantic and practical in SF in winter (or whenever!). We love visiting San francisco and we will be baack to the Petite Auberge

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the City”
Reviews.Author: Sukers
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for a little weekend getaway for me and my partner. The staff was friendly, helpful and unpretentious. The hotel was charming , nicely decorated, and clean. The afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres were delicious featuring a fresh green salad and nice selection of wines. The full breakfast was great, too. The location is right in the heart of downtown, a few blocks from Union Square and our room had a bay window seat overlooking Bush St. Yet we were able to sleep soundly with very little street noise. The room itself was warm and comfortable, with a great bathtub. We were able to easily use public transportation to get around when we didn't just walk down to the many restaurants nearby. I'll definitely plan another weekend to SF at Petite Auberge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wish I could visit San Francisco more often!”
Reviews.Author: BookGirl26
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Everything about my stay was great: great location, great room, great food, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: kjweiss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at Petite Auberge. We were attracted by the location and the price. We found those were as promised, but we found so much more: a charming, spacious room including working fireplace; a tasty and generous hot breakfast + wine reception every day; parking included in our very reasonable nightly price; most pleasant personnel - from the floor maid to the woman in charge of breakfasts to the people manning the front desk; easy walk to Union Square, dozens of restaurants and the famed Cable Car. Only concern - Petite Auberge is an older building; best to have an upper-floor room as foot-falls over our 4th floor room were loud (this happened only once or twice - people were very thoughtful in this regard). We will definitely return to Petite Auberge when our leisure or business travel takes us back to 'the city by the bay.'

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem.”
Reviews.Author: SusanMarieUK
Reviews.Content: The Petite Auberge is absolutely spotless, the front desk personnel so extremely courteous, and the location is unbeatable. I'd read reviews here before I went, and I can say for certain (at least in our experience), they were all absolutely on target. The rooms were delightful with pleasant decor and good bath (with shelves, how nice). Where else can you come into your room, flick on the switch and have your fireplace come to life? Was great for those chilly March days. Best of all is downstairs -- great place to be. Comfy seating areas with chilled wine and tasty snacks to sit and enjoy. The morning buffet was well tended and had all we needed. We also walked next door to the sister hotel (White Swan) and would recommend this establishment's afternoon treats equally... Relaxing with a glass of wine in front of a fireplace before having to rush out to the airport late in the afternoon. Two nice bistros within walking distance, as well as Chinatown and Nob Hill. Would recommend this establishment unconditionally.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love!”
Reviews.Author: 2fromUT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at Petite Auberge to celebrate his 60th anniversary. We booked as part of a Travelocity package trip, so had only seen photos on website. We had a standard room, no fireplace, but we loved it! Lovely furnishings, comfy bed, immaculate. The complementary breakfast was fabulous and wine and munchies in the evening was a really nice touch in the inviting dining/living area of the basement. It was perfect for meeting other guests. We made reservations for our anniversary in 2011 and will be staying longer!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: Princeoftides
Reviews.Content: Petite Auberge is a very comfortable place to spend a few days in San Francisco. The location is ideal, the breakfast is very good, and the afternoon wine and cheese (and pasta, and devilled eggs, etc) was a real nice touch, and a great way to meet fellow travellers. Keep in mind that it is an old building and that there will be problems associated with its age. We had an unexpected extra shower in the bathroom courtesy of a leak from the room above. I was also surprised to read of complaints in reviews several years old regarding the TV swivel not working properly. We had to wedge ours in place with a magazine. This is surely an area in need of attention.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: carolkross
Reviews.Content: From the friendliness of the front desk personnel to the spotless room and bathroom, our stay for three nights at Petite Auberge could not have been better. The hotel offers a wine tasting each evening that allows guests to meet other guests. During our stay we had several delightful conversations with fellow travelers. The breakfasts included with the stay were delicious. Fresh pastries, omelettes, croissants, fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereals, yougurt, it was more like a full course restauraunt than a continental breakfast. We found the staff to be very knowledgeable about local restauraunts. Each of their suggestions that we tried were scrumptious. I loved having the fireplace in the bedroom, lending a cozy enviornment to a quiet and peaceful end to a busy day. I know you would love this gem of a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice retreat in a big city”
Reviews.Author: bluelightning
Reviews.Content: Petite Auberge has a pleasant, homey atmosphere. Location is outstanding - easy walk to Union Square or public transportation. My room was somewhat small, but adequate. Bathroom needed some repairs. There wa a hole in the tile under the faucet in the bathtub and the sink had a crack in it. The breakfast and evening wine with appetizers were both good and gave us a chance to speak with other guests in a relaxed setting. Being an older building the main problem we had was that the floors are very squeaky. It sounded like the person in the room above us paced for hours. There was no street noise. Ear plugs are offered by the hotel it desired.

Reviews.Title: “BEST KEPT SECRET”
Reviews.Author: vinaka_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at Petit Auberg . The hotel is pleasant and conveniently situated in downtown San Francisco. There are lots of fine restaurants in the street where P.A. is located. The one we really liked is Jeanne d' Arc where the price is raasonable and the food so tasty. The environment in P.A. is friendly and the atmosphere very homely. We ate exqusitely freshly made cookies every day. Wine is included in the evenings. The breakfast is superb. It's truly a gourmet breakfast with cereal,quiche, boiled eggs, tea, coffee and toast. The bread is freshly made at the hotel. The hotel room is comfortable. The staff is friendly. We made friends with Andy. He gave us some good tips on where to go for shopping and bargains. He has a fantastic sense of humor. If you wish to get away to some place quiet and cosy without all the tinsels and frills P.A is the place to go. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful 30th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: terrischurr
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Petite Auberge. It was more than we expected. The room was lovely. We really enjoyed the fireplace. The breakfasts were wonderful. The cookies, wine and hors d'oeuvres were delicious and very much appreciated at the end of the day. We will definitely return to Petite Auberge. Thank you for a wonderful 30th Anniversary Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: AJ215
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel. I love the decor and how cozy it is. We got a deluxe queen room with a fireplace and feel right at home. The daily wine cocktail hour doesn't hurt either. The staff is friendly, though we honestly haven't seen that much staff since getting here. I'd definitely stay here again the next time I'm in San Francisco. Word to the wise: I did get a peek at the regular rooms and they are tiny. Deluxe is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Value stay with nice extras”
Reviews.Author: Boston_T_Party
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days at a business conference in Union Square. For the money this is a good place for the money with convenience to Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown and Financial District. I am not a big fan of the frilly decor and the piped in French music, but the facility is fine for a short-term stay and the staff is welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was really nice. The common areas are more like a home than a typical hotel. I spent a few hours working on my laptop with a cup of tea next to the fireplace in the "living room" area. The hotel has a small and intimate garden space outside to sit (weather permitting!). There were a few annoyances including a room next to elevator (a bit noisy at night) and a ventilation fan in the bathroom that sounded like a DC-3 taking off. Overall, though, very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “It reminds us of the wonderful B & B's we stay in during our travels in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: LilyTacomaWashington
Reviews.Content: "What a pleasant experience from the time we checked in until leaving. Reminded us of B&B's we stayed in during European travels. Rooms very comfortable. Excellent full breakfast. Wine reception at 5 p.m. was excellent. Found many things in common with others at the wine reception. Similar tastes and travel experiences. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was recommended to us by a friend and we will recommend to others without reservation."

Reviews.Title: “A cozy boutique hotel with great character”
Reviews.Author: Maxinette
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Petite Auberge over Thanksgiving weekend. It was a great experience. Much more real San Francisco neighbourhood experience than staying in big business hotels near Union Square. Yet it is a short walk from downtown shopping and other activities. It was nice the take an evening walk in Nob Hill area a few blocks up with spectacular views and great architecture. Our room was cozy with beautiful Provence style decor with a fireplace. Wine reception with small snacks in the lobby with a fireplace was a great way to relax before the dinner. We also saw a theater play a few steps away next door (Actor's theater) which was a great production. Overall, a great hotel in which we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Bit of Old San Francisco--With Great Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: WashDCMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and really enjoyed it. The hotel is in a very safe, charming location, the staff was wonderful, the room very comfortable and clean. And the breakfast buffet was excellent--as was the evening reception. Petite Auberge is very "country French," and you get that feeling of cozy fellowship you might find in an old New England ski lodge. The old (1920s?) elevator was really neat; if you have kids, tell them to watch through the small window in the elevator door as the car rises to your floor, to see the ursine stowaway attached to the elevator cable. Our deluxe room was spacious and renovated but kept in the Victorian style. The TV got a lot of channels via cable. (Note: It sits on a sliding platter that pulls out of the armoire.) The gas fireplace in particular was wonderful; it was almost as lively and convincing as a wood-burning one. I was glad to see that in addition to curtains, there were actual shades on the windows. To my surprise, it was not at all noisy at night; one great thing about San Francisco is that people hardly ever honk their car horns. (I did wear earplugs as a preventive measure. The inn provides them if you ask.) The shower water pressure was incredible! I also give them points for putting a recycling bin in the room next to the trash bin. And they have free wi-fi in the lobby! (Plus a computer you can use next door at the White Swan). With historic inns, you're trading absolute consistency and modernity for charm and personality. You have to accept that going in. In the case of Petite Auberge, we could hear the footsteps of the people above us very clearly. But this is to be expected in a building from the 19th Century. There was a tiny bit of wallpaper starting to peel in the otherwise very inviting bathroom. (Wallpaper in a steamy environment never works; someone should get the word out to hotel owners.) One of the window shades was stuck, but they sent the service guy to fix it quickly while we were out. The heat is controlled centrally, so you can't adjust it in your room. But the gas fireplace puts out a lot of heat, and you can open a window or ditch the comforter if you're too warm. We found the temperature comfortable. There is not always someone at the front desk, but the staff were exceptionally helpful, with a genuinely cheerful attitude that is so often missing at big hotels. (You can also call 0 at any time to get someone at the White Swan.) The free breakfast was really sumptuous: several types of pastry, fruit, quiche, cereal, great sausage links, a couple of kinds of juice. They also have a fridge full of drinks for guests to help themselves to. The evening reception has a couple of wines and some nice hors d'oeuvres (cheeses one night, bread pudding the next). It's a good chance to chat with other guests. Before our trip, I had worried that we would find aggressive panhandlers everywhere in San Francisco; however, there were almost none where we went. Nob Hill is very safe, even at night. If you like historic inns, you've absolutely love Petite Auberge.

Reviews.Title: “Love the character and location”
Reviews.Author: LivingByTheSecond
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Petite Auberge (and third with Joie De Vivre hotels) and we'll happily return for more. The character is fun - not haughty, not casual, but just a nice polite and comforting friend. We stayed in a queen with fireplace and the ambiance was very enjoyable. The location rocks because the hotel is central to a lot of fun areas to explore. Cable car is close, too.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Calred53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to this hotel for several years now. The location is excellent, the staff are wonderful, and the rooms are very comfortable. Lots of old fashioned charm. This hotel is like a home away from home. Also great access to shopping, North Beach, public transit and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Petite Auberge Hotel is a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: coastaltugger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Petite Auberge Hotel recently. We were delighted with the friendly and courteous staff. The rooms are quaint, cozy and very comfortable. The in-room fireplace added so much to the charm of the hotel. The breakfast was delicious and exceeded our expectations. The Petite Auberge is a delightful change from large, impersonal hotels. I've already recommended The Petite Auberge to my friends. We look forward to staying again when in San Francisco. Dr. E. and Mr. J. Pieterse

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashion Charm”
Reviews.Author: Ujena
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Petite Auberge several time in the last few years and think of it as our home away from home in the grand city of San Francisco. It is centrally located to all the great resturants, entertainment, and of course shopping! We will be back again when visiting San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “The Petite Auberge, San Francisco, Ca”
Reviews.Author: DickJac
Reviews.Content: This is one of the very best hotels that we have stayed at. Very fine service, friendly staff, Excellent room and a great breakfast. I would highly recommed it for your next trip to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: grg25
Reviews.Content: we were a little confused at check in as the Petite Auberge seems to be the unmanned hotel next door to the White Swan. However, our room was lovely with a great fireplace - although I have to admit that after a hard day's sightseeing it would have been nice to have a tv to laze in front of!! Nice lounge with coffee available and wine for guests in the early evening. Lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Charm on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: labahia
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny, and the hotel does not look as nice as it does in the pictures. They lay on the 'french countryside' look quite thick. But it's still very nice, and a great value, and the french-theme has its benefits, such as cheese and wine tastings. They clearly make more of an effort than other places with similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JennieNashville_TN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights there. Room was "cozy" - code for somewhat small. The inn could use some updating. BUT - staff was friendly, breakfast was good and does save you $. I would prefer they vary the selection and the toaster does take forever. Loved the old elevator - you can get soft drinks and water whenever you like from the fridge downstairs. The street is a little scary at night but lots of the side streets are. You are 1 1/2 blocks from the cable car stop on Powell so it is pretty convenient. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this hotel....shabby and not very clean.”
Reviews.Author: fionad48
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Petite Auberge on the information in the Rough Guide to San Francisco - they rated it â€œluxurious and memorable with a sumptuous breakfastâ€� - I would not agree with any of these statements. As far as we were concerned it was not luxurious - I thought it was shabby and not very clean and the breakfast was a very ordinary buffet with a toaster that took ten minutes to do one piece of bread and lukewarm coffee. It is situated within a few block of Union Square in a slightly run down area - sadly San Francisco is beset with an inordinate number of rough sleepers and vagrants and this area has a number of hostels and seems to attract them. Okay during the day but when you come back on foot at night this can be a little intimidating. The worst problem was the noise outside and inside the building - after being up for 24 hours the people in the room above ours must have had an early flight and they got up at 3.00 in the morning and banged and crashed and wheeled their luggage about and it felt like they were in the room with us. Also some people came back at one in the morning the corridors are very narrow and their loud voices woke us up as well - they even offer you ear plugs so we are not the only ones to complain. The blinds in our very small room were all ripped and the net curtains were dirty, there was hair in the bathroom which was not ours!! The bathroom was miniscule and the wash hand basin was in the bedroom ..... I hope that JDV group spend a little money on the hall carpets which were badly stained and dirty. I am glad that we spent the last three days of holiday in the Hotel Drisco in the peace and tranquillity of Pacific Heights. We were also charged 40 dollars to have our car parked.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST STOP ON OUR ANNIVERSARY TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: Lestersmommy
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I landed in San Francisco around noon and got here before 1pm- they were very nice to ket us check in early ! We stayed in the petite suite which is in the very back of the hotel with it's own terrace and enterance. It is lovely! We sat outside every evening on the cute iron furniture. The oom was nice- we had a jetted tub in the bathroom and a gas fireplace. The bed was pretty- hand painted King sized- very comfy., We did have an issue with plumbin- but the management is top notch and more then made up for it! The hotel does need some cosmetic touch ups- peeling paint, bathroom fixtures etc. But they are always busy so I bet they cant schedule the maintaince. The breakfast is nice and saves you $$. I only wish they varied it- when you stay several days- it gets old- even if it is free. Same with the evening wine/snacks- free is perfect, but it they varied it it would be AMAZING! This is a good area- 2 blocks from the cable car. Felt very safe at night. Overall very nice!

Reviews.Title: “This is a charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KR S
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel just off Union Square. The rates were very reasonable - We booked the nonrefundable one. The website warns that the Cozy Queen room is small - It is, but reminded us of little French hotels where we have stayed. Who needs a big room in San Francisco anyway? You are only going to sleep in it, right? The buffet breakfast was great, especially the breads and muffins. If you happen to be there late in the afternoon, there is complimentary wine and cheese and sweets. No lobby computer, but the staff will confirm your flight and print your boarding passes. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and homey bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kosette
Reviews.Content: The service was very pleasant and helpful. The room was absolutely charming and comfortable, also very clean. We stayed in the Deluxe King. The room had a fireplace, bookshelves, and nice windows to see some of the city. The social hour with wine and cheese was even better than I expected. We had to leave early so we didn't get to sample all of the breakfast, but what we did have was very fresh and tasty. The B&B was only a few blocks from the street cars that go down to Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Afton_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in Sept. 09. Charming hotel and great value in an expensive city. We booked the cozy queen and it was quite adequate in size. Rate included breakfast and evening reception. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt go back”
Reviews.Author: tiggerjr82
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very pretty, service was fabulous. But the hotel is not well maintained, we may have just been unlucky but the first room we were in was so noisy we were moved to another which had a blocked toilet that flooded the room (and by the smell and wet floor this was not a new issue) then moved to a new room where the lights and tap didnt work. No rooms had curtains which is an issue for me as a light sleeper, no air con which contrary to popular belief IS needed in san francisco as it was warm and muggy. We were told to open the windows, its so noisy though that lead to no sleep either. Overall it was disappointing. I did send a complaint to the management but have had no reply. Hotel offers free wifi but it didnt work most of the time we were there. Oh and there is a $32 a night charge for valet parking and in a scarily busy part of SF we couldnt take the risk finding somewhere to leave the car so had to pay over $100 with taxes for 3 nights parking! Oh and the breakfast... it tries to be french cuisine but was poor choice to be honest

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: CtKnitter
Reviews.Content: Things we loved about the place: the over-all ambience, our room (Room 25), the central location, the other guests (mostly international), breakfast (variety of breads/rolls/pastries/hot&cold cereal, eggs, sausage, fresh fruit), wine reception that included multiple cheeses, crackers, appetizers & dessert (we are not drinkers - they also had teas & coffee). The common area was comfortably cozy (yet another fireplace!) & very condusive to enjoyable conversations with other guests. I don't know why anyone would stay in an institutionally-decorated, impersonal chain hotel when they could stay at a charming, comfortable inn like this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lorib49
Reviews.Content: My husband I I stayed at the Petite Auberge about 3 weeks ago for 5 days. We had an excellent stay. We had one of the basic homes and it was more than adequate. We spent most of our time sightseeing, therefore we had no need for a large room. The staff was so helpful and accomodating. They went out of their way to give directions and recommend restaurants. The breakfast was good every morning, with plenty of healthy choices. We especially enjoyed the cookies that were put out every day as well as the fruit and drinks provided. Another thing that was not mentioned on this page was that the guests at the Petite Auberge could use the fitness room at the White Swan. This was especially nice for my husband who wanted to use the treadmill. Overall it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best B&B I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: llinnie008
Reviews.Content: The Petite Auberge is the most darling inn centrally located near Union Square. You can literally walk just 2 blocks to the cable car and 4 blocks to China Town. It is just so convenient. And the staff is so accomodating and professional as well. One of the best things they offer with your stay is a delightful breakfast and also wine and cheese in the afternoon after a full day of gadding about. Oh, and did I mention the fresh-made cookies that are available? The rooms are cozy too..most with fireplaces. I love San Francisco and this is the only place I will stay when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in San Francisco's Petite Auberge !!!”
Reviews.Author: yanaparis
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in that fantastic Petite Auberge at the end of our west coast trip. It was really perfectly in the right spot : 2 blocks from Union Square, it's vivid life and all the transports,( the Cable Car even stops a 100m from the hotel !), and still very quiet ! We had an adorable queen size-Fireplace room (nÂ°45), spacious, comfortable, perfectly clean, and so completely romantic! The wine-time (instead of tea-time !), was the perfect spot to taste Californian Wine, and above all to have a fantastic moment to meet all the other guests of the hotel, and to exchange all the best things to do all over the place ! a really great melting pot, we met awesome people ! And of course, don't miss the breakfast, every day something different, fresh fruits, delicious ! We'll definitely come back to Petite Auberge !

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Petite Auberge”
Reviews.Author: toothfairy814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petite Auberge for 3 nights in July. It was wonderful. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay a pleasant one. The room was perfect, the breakfast delicious, and the wine reception in the evening was a wonderful way to wind down after a long day of seeing the city. Melissa, our San Francisco Greeter was amazing. She had us all over the city seeing things that we definitely would have missed without her. I only wish we could have stayed longer. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It was centrally located, close to trolleys and bus lines. Give it a try, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: M1chael
Reviews.Content: We chose Petite Auberge based on the reviews. Those who reviewed the hotel before must not have stayed in Room 22. The room was very small, with the bathroom the size of a cruise ship bathroom. The view was that of an ugly brick building across a small courtyard. When we first checked in, I asked if we could be moved since the room was next to the elevator and stairs, and within 20 feet of the lobby door. I was told the hotel was fully booked. As suspected, we were kept awake most of the night with the sound of the banging front door and elevator. This is not something they are unaware of since they supply you with a white noise machine in the room. Even at full volume, it could not drown out the sound of guests coming and going. If we had paid $59 a night, this might have been acceptable, but we expected better given the room cost and reviews. We will stay away from this hotel and it's sister hotel The Swan since they appear to be under the same management. If the hotel management reads this -- do your guests a favor and make room 22 a storage space!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Irish11s
Reviews.Content: If you want a wonderful accommodation while visiting San Francisco, I suggest you stay at Petite Auberge. The room we occupied with the fireplace was charmingly decorated and very comfortable. Each day began with a wholesome hardy breakfast with a nice variety of selections, a great start for each day. Each evening, we were welcomed back with a delicious assortment of appetizers and choice of wines while enjoying interesting & fun conversations with other guests. The staff at Petite Auberge was fantastic with their genuine friendliness and helpfulness. Petite Auberge is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco close to Cable Cars, Chinatown and wonderful restaurants. Petite Auberge was our perfect "home away from home"on our visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: salsagirl1953
Reviews.Content: Every year in August we celebrate our wedding anniversary and if we happen to stay home, (we live in the Bay Area), we end up spending a weekend in the City and stay at the Petite Auberge. I have researched other hotels in SF and found bargains and nice reviews but when I get ready to book a room for us, we always end up at the Petite Auberge. The beds are comfy and the breakfast is good. We have met so many interesting people at the evening wine reception. As soon as we step in through the door from busy Bush Street we feel like we've stepped into another world, very French country and peaceful. Maybe someday we will visit another hotel but this one always seems to welcome us home.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. The hotel appears to have decided to cost cut in a big way”
Reviews.Author: beakytraveller
Reviews.Content: I say "appears to have cost cut" despite not staying there before because I can only imagine that the combination of excellent past reviews and substandard service now mean that changes must have been made. Going through the 5 different categories above: Cleanliness: Good standard of clean each day; Location: Excellent. Right near Union Square (shopping area), the cable car lines and generally quite a cool area; Rooms: I think I was in the "Deluxe with fireplace". The concierge said, as he waited for the lift to help with our things, "oh I didn't look at your room, you're in a good one" with a surprising tone. I thought the room was pretty average myself; quite small, not a comfortable bed and just generally felt quite tired. It is worth noting that the room is done in quite an antiquey style, so if you like that then you may well like it more than i did. I am pretty indifferent to an antiquey style. Slight problem with the squeaky floor boards in the room above, but nothing major. Value: paid Â£150/$240 a night. I expect a lot more than I got for this and finally... Service: There were a series of incidents which lead me to give this only 1/5: 1. Whenever we needed to speak to the concierge/front desk we were pretty disappointed that there isn't one most of the time. There is a sign up at the entrance of the petite auberge which simply states - "please go to our sister hotel - the White Swan Inn". It is only next door, but given I didn't have a key to it and that I was under the impression that my hotel would have its own reception I wasn't massively impressed. 2. Checking out was quite annoying, mainly as a result of the above again. I rung the reception (which didn't answer within 10 rings each of the 5-6 times we rung during our stay) and asked for my car from the valet (see below) Trying to save time I took our stuff out of the room and walked down the corrindor to the entrance. However there was no car for a while, I tried to call reception again (only the white swans of course) and there was no answer. I walked around the reception and asked if he could just call reception in the Petite Auberge, which I was sitting next to, unmanned of course, waiting for my car with our stuff. I was told that he didn't know how to work the phones so that would be possible. 3. They ask that you give 20-30 minutes for the car to come from the valet. 20-30 minutes? Madness. I can only assume it is because they have so few staff working at any one time to actually serve the guests. (There is a lot of mention of the cost of the valet in other reviews. This, however, is a red herring in my opinion. $32 for valet parking a night is actually the cheapest I saw in central San Francisco, so not a big deal. It is just an expensive city to park in. Possibly it is cheaper than the other valet because they require such long notice...) 4. Finally the non reception staff seem to have been hired cheaply. The woman providing the breakfast was struggling to understand me and the cleaner seemed positively fearful of a question. Sorry to have written such a long review, but I felt that giving 1/5 for service required a lengthy explanation

Reviews.Title: “My new hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Chrisamoon
Reviews.Content: I am happy to report that I have found my new favorite hotel in San Francisco. The Petite Auberge has everything that I could possibly want. Quiet, peaceful location but easy walking distance to Union Square and Nob Hill. Comfortable beds, lovely decor, gracious staff, spotless rooms, amazing breakfasts...all those little touches that make you feel catered to. I have recommended the hotel to friends and now I recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: yymca6
Reviews.Content: It is pretty hard to make a review without repeating what others have said already. My main point is that it stands to its reputation as a quality hotel. One must know it is a pretty old building, so floors can be squeaky once in a while but if every one does not "jump" out of bed, everything's OK. As for prior complaints on hearing plumbing noises, mine only goes to fellow travelers who were discreet enough to take a shower after 1AM... Otherwise no noise, even from the street (we were in room 31 up front on second floor). There were not that many people when we were there 1st week of July and we were pretty much often out in the city, so we only went once to the 5PM wine and cheese but liked it and met very nice people. Location is terrific : 2 streets away from cable car on Powell, walkable distance to North Beach (Italian restaurants) and China Town and downtown shopping. Lots of restaurants in the area, deli across the street if you want some munchies or extra wine. Staff is very nice and provided us with lots of relevant info on sightseeing. If we ever go back to Frisco, we will DEFINITELY return to the Petite Auberge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, attention to detail, prime location in SF”
Reviews.Author: 2draw
Reviews.Content: I will return to the hotel next time I visit San Francisco. Upon check in we were given a print out of recommended restaurants in the area. A list of events in the surrounding area was prominently displayed as well as a selection of free guide magazines. The hotel staff was very helpful from the front desk, housekeeping, to the lovely ladies who organized the breakfast area. Complementary breakfast in the morning was buffet style. Quiche, french toast,sausage,oatmeal, fresh fruit, assorted pastries,fresh juice, coffee, tea etc. The seating area was decorated with a lovely mural that reminded me of one I saw in France. Beautiful. Although the room was spacious and well maintained we enjoyed finishing our day of touring San Francisco by relaxing in the downstairs living room next to the fireplace with a good book. The hotel is in a comfortable neighborhood, safe to walk around, convenient to mini grocers, a wonderful pizza parlour, the Powell St. cable car, BART, Chinatown and so much more.

Reviews.Title: “The Petite Auberge is our home while staying in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: jrtgrs
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Petite Auberge 5 times in the last 5 years and each stay has been a pleasure. On our recent stay, we were pleased to hear many first time visitors finding the same delight with the Petite Auberge as we have come to expect. The breakfasts are great, and the evening wine gathering is a good time to meet other travelers. This is the perfect location for walking San Francisco, catching the cable car or just feeling at home in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Memories...............many thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Raftsman
Reviews.Content: Our stay all too short at the Petite Auberge, San Francisco came art the end of a 3 week road trip crammed with happy memories. We had picked and booked the hotel using the on-line booking service and had relied on the hotel web site and Trip Advisor to inform our choice. We were not disappointed. We arrived at about 18.30 and were warmly welcomed and offered (free!) Californian Chardonay, salad, cheese and biscuits. Very welcome! It turned out that this spread is laid out in the comfortable lounge each evening from about 17.30. This provided a great opportunity to meet and exchange stories with our fellow guests. There were also delicious home baked, (I assume), cake and cookies with tea and coffee available at all times. The complementary breakfast bufet offered a good selection with fresh cooked hot options. This spread set us up for a hard days sightseeing and gallery visiting. The hotel seemed well positioned with Union Square just 10mins. away. This is a great character hotel and I would say it was a bit special.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: slarsen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Petite Auberge earlier this month for our 30th anniversary. Three nights...wonderful atmosphere, breakfast each morning was delicious, and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “You can't do better in San Francisco!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: farrahnyc
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my trip was both business and pleasure. While my colleagues stayed at one of the major hotel chains, I was at one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. They were quite jealous as I described my wonderful oasis in the big city. Petite Auberge had everything. The location in Union Square was perfect. Clean, beautifully decorated rooms, a friendly, extremely helpful staff, excellent breakfasts and a lovely wine reception each afternoon where I could meet some of the other guests are some of it's highlights. And, of course, the fireplace in the room was most appreciated after a gruelling day of meetings. No research need for my next San Francisco trip...I will definitely return to Petit Auberge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: walter792002
Reviews.Content: I am from Texas and I wanted to get the San Francisco experience a little bit and our family got it here. This was a great place to stay. Everything was so easy, check in, gentleman carried our bags to our room, the clean room, the view of the street, was a great experience. I would stay again and tell anyone I knew to stay there, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the great service”
Reviews.Author: Guinness60
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is ok, but could be great with some updating. The staff here are exceptional....the concierge was so eager to assist with our plans and making reservations. Everyone from the valet to housekeeping greeted you with a smile. I booked two rooms, one for my husband and me, and one for my parents. Each of our rooms cost the exact same however, my parents room was very small, and the bathroom had a stand up shower with no tub that could use a serious scrubbing. Our room was much larger with a fireplace and a tub shower. The sink in our room was a little questionable with the dry wall behind it crumbling a bit from water damage, nothing a little caulk couldn't fix. I would only go back if I knew I would get the larger of the two rooms. There was a lot of street noise and noise from the people next to us. On the other hand, the location was excellent, and the staff was so pleasant, I was able to forget about some of the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but tiny and noisy with plumbing and cleanliness issues.”
Reviews.Author: davinna
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in June. We booked because of the great Tripadvisor reviews and we have stayed at two other jdv hotels with great success. (Try Hotel Los Gatos if you are staying in the Silicon Valley) While the staff was very friendly and helpful, we just don't understand the rave reviews. Our room was tiny. We could hear the noise on Bush street all night and especially early morining. Dual paned windows would have made it acceptable. Our sink was clogged and we had several black hairs in our shower. My wife was so grossed out by the bathroom she refused to shower there. Breakfast was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home”
Reviews.Author: HappyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: The Petite Auberge was an incredibly pleasant surprise. Even after reading the rave reviews, we were amazed at our stay there. In fact, of all the things we did in San Francisco, and we did plenty, the Petite Auberge was the highlight of the trip. The hotel was clean and the atmosphere was relaxed and homey. The rooms were comfortable although a bit small. We upgraded to a larger room with a fireplace for a minimal charge and were glad we did. What sets the Petite Auberge apart is the services and relaxed atmosphere. Breakfast is served buffet style. The food is just put out and you help yourself. The food normally included a quiche, waffles or some other egg dish, some sausage or meat, cereals, fresh fruit, muffins and pastries, and a very wide choice of breads. A choice of juices, coffees, and teas are available. The hotel offers cookies, apples, oranges, pop and bottled water free of charge throughout the day (and night). We used those ammenities to create a small lunch. Cocktail hour, or whatever it should be called was an extreme highlight. Supposedly from 5:00 -6:30, although it often went till 9:00 pm, wine is put out for guests along with cheese, crackers of various sorts, and often came with a salad and some other food such as a pasta dish one night, and a spice cake the other. During the week, we made a habit of attending this. Eating the food in a living room setting with a fireplace helped facilitate conversations amongst guests. Almost every day, we spent around 2.5 hours just talking to different guests. I have never experienced anything quite like it. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, but they took a hands off approach which allowed guests to really feel like they could mingle. All in all, it was an incredibly positive experience that I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Dream”
Reviews.Author: heavenlydream
Reviews.Content: This French Country Inn hotel is off the chart! The staff made me & my spouse feel important and needed. Our room was in the 3rd floor, comfortable & spacious enough for 2 people, we liked the windows facing the bed and when you look down is the serene garden. The queen size bed is comfortable and they gave us extra pillows for more comfort. DO NOT missed the complimentary breakfast! the food is excellent, soothing ambiance, newspaper ready to read, a 24hr all you can drink beverages plus ice, if you need it. You have to meet "Filipina" Patricia. She works hard, all smiles, very comforting lady & always made the breakfast area refilled and cleaned. They also have a valet parking, our car came in & out in tacked. The location is excellent, the price rate is affordable, the bathroom has everything you need and toilet works. I truly recommend this place to everyone to experience a heavenly dream. We love this hotel, we will come back again. You will wake up and leave with all smiles, especially with some free cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, comfortable rooms, delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: JLF50
Reviews.Content: Seeking a hotel with more charm than brass and glass, I was delighted to find Petite Auberge. The room I had was not large, but it was all I needed - clean, comfortable and welcoming. I liked being able to open my window and hear street sounds (not too loud). My stay was great and the price was extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great ambiance, and yummy food!”
Reviews.Author: mmsCharlotte_Nc
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights and would go back in a heartbeat. The location was wonderful - a few blocks from union square, great restaurant recommendations within walking distance. The breakfast was delicious - homemade bread, oatmeal, quiche - definitely as good as any B&B in France! The afternoon wine was a great way to meet other hotel guests an relax before a night out. We had a great visit and would highly recommend the Petit Auberge!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: J-Dangle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great staff! Great breakfast, and complimentary water, sodas, fruit etc. Love the fire place...Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “It was an absolutely wonderful stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzymoon
Reviews.Content: The Petite Auberge is a hidden gem in the city of San Francisco. The inn was comfortable, roomy, charming, and beautifully designed. It was also romantic with the large fireplace in our room. The staff was very professional and helpful. We would recommend the Petite Auberge Inn to all our friends and family. It was an absolutely wonderful stay in San Francisco. K&K

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Dan1954
Reviews.Content: The Petite Auberge is a lovely little hotel. We stayed in a deluxe Queen with fireplace whilst on honeymoon. The room was a really good size with a nice bathroom and plenty of light. Breakfast was very good with a good selection. The hotel is well located in easy walking distance of Union Square and the ferry building. There is a cable car stop just down the road. Like other reviewers I would recommend joining the JDV club prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable from the first minute to the last”
Reviews.Author: Euriga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of spending a weekend in San Francisco and stayed at a comfortable, cozy, and inviting Hotel called Petite Auberge, 863 Bush St. It is styled after a French Country Inn. We were made to feel welcome and comfortable from the beginning to end. The employees treated us in a very courteous and accommodating manner. The valet service was excellent. The breakfasts were healthy and generous and the late afternoon wines and delights were relaxing and enjoyable in a cozy and comfortable setting. We enjoyed the stay at the Hotel to the extent that we booked it again for our Son and wife later in the month. The Hotel upgraded their room with a fireplace and will provide them with chocolate and champagne upon arrival. Quite a nice gesture we thought. Go soon and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A cozy haven at the end of a busy day.”
Reviews.Author: zunibc
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with a fireplace and I was so glad I did. I spent a lot of time either out walking in the brisk San Francisco spring breeze or in a chilly conference room (at another hotel) so to come "home" to my cozy room at the end of the day was an absolute pleasure. The 5 p.m. wine reception was also welcome and it was fun to relax and talk to other guests. This hotel has character, wonderful breakfasts, and genuine hospitality and it was very good value right downtown. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: NaturalSugar
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel on the internet and what a surprise! It was as good as (if not better than) the reviews I had read! The staff was wonderfully pleasant and accomodating - even at my request to check out a little later than I had planned. The wine reception was delightful and much needed after a long travel day! The room was very clean and cozy and added to my ability to feel refreshed the next day. The location in downtown SF was an added bonus - just a few minutes to Chinatown and Union Square! I slept with the windows slightly opened and couldn't even tell that I was even in the city! This is definitely one hotel on my favorites list!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Warm and Welcoming Victorian Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: socaltripper1
Reviews.Content: We found this B&B on line, the website photos and description were very attractive. We had never stayed at a bed and breakfast before and were pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and beautiful lobby as we arrived. We were not dissapointed. Parking is a dilema anywhere in SF but our car was immediately unloaded by a bellman and taken to a secure offsite lot (with in and out privelages)and our luggage was immediately taken to our room. We arrived a few minutes before the social hour was to close so it was held open for us to get to relax with other guests by the fire and unwind with a glass (or two) of wine and snacks. The B&B was within walking distance of the shopping and financial district as well as the transportation hub for cable, bus and subway. We had breakfast in bed one morning( the service was great) and enjoyed the downstairs breakfast room another morning. Our room was very cozy and nicely decorated with french country decor. The fireplace added the perfect touch for our retreats back to the room. We felt very safe and comfortable our entire trip. We only had two discomforts that can be remedied: the pillows were not very comfortable (ask for others or bring your own) and the bathroom floors were cold (bare floors (bring your slippers?)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor”
Reviews.Author: travelnutIdaho
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautifully decorated and had a lovely fireplace. It was clean and well furnished with beautiful nicknacks. The location couldn't be better. Easy walking distance to Union Square, the top of Nob Hill, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown and North Beach.. The staff was so very friendly and helpful. We loved the wine and appetizers each evening and met some very nice people there. What a charming elevator!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of home in California.”
Reviews.Author: adam333
Reviews.Content: We are in our 70's and had the most enjoyable visit we have had in a long time. Not only were we treated as a guest but also as part of a family. The guide provided helped us to make the most of our visit and we were able to walk to places we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Just like an excellent hotel in Paris for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: guillaume22
Reviews.Content: One would immediately likes this hotel if he/she is "educated" as a Rick Steve style budget traveller. La Petite Auberge is certainly small, central, and friendly. Moreover, as its name implies, it feels just like a hotel in Paris (in terms of its size, style of elevator, soundproof-ness, etc), so it is characteristic. The cozy queen room where we stayed, which is small, has a shower just like what you can find at some small Paris hotels, and is warm. With respect to the low season price we got, PA is a great value. (Try to book on its own site, as there may be promotions with imaginative names solely available on the site.). After a week long trip from LA to SF and staying at chain hotels along the way, PA's complimentary breakfast was a godsend, and it was fun to taste Italian spice flavored quiche. There is also a reception from 5 to 7 with simple hors d'oeuvre, which is an interesting "culture" event worth experiencing (can't find in Paris). It is also worth noting that there is a free WiFi supplied via AT&T now with a good reception (ask front desk for a password). The TV in our room was still 20' CRT but we didn't bother to turn it on since there were live opera show to be watched in SF, after finishing the complimentary hors d'oeuvre. We can't wait for returning to La Petite Auberge to claim a teddy bear that will be given to return visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Petite Auberge-Cozy and cute!”
Reviews.Author: taikobaby
Reviews.Content: It was such a delight to stay at Petite Auberge for two nights. It is centrally located and the walk from Market/Powell is about ten minutes. As a Joy of Life Member (apply for free on the hotel's website), my boyfriend and I were upgraded to a queen guest room with a fireplace. We were also given a complimentary split of red wine and bon bons which was included in the free membership. The evening reception was fantastic (gourmet cheese and crackers, vegetable tray, apple streusel, and wine (red, white) and sherry. Bottled water is free. The complimentary breakfast was delicious (scrambled and boiled eggs, sausage, quiche, danishes, scones, croissants, assortment of breads (great sourdough, wheat, white), fresh cut fruit, coffee, tea, orange juice, and cranberry juice). The local paper was delivered every morning and they had USA Today available in the lounge with a fireplace. The hotel is very quaint and cozy and really does feel like a small French country inn. The hotel staff from the concierge to housekeeping were friendly and knowledgeable. The front desk recommended a great tapas place in the Mission District and also printed by boarding passes for me. I met a couple during the evening reception that told me they stayed at Petite Auberge 16 years ago. I can understand why they returned and I certainly plan to do the same the next time I visit SF!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: MemberFlorida
Reviews.Content: The Petite Auberge was lovely. The staff members were kind and professional. The room was perfect, the breakfast was delicious, and the overall atmosphere was warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: NoelleDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petite Auberge from October 27 to 30th this year and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is queit, ciomfortable, and the staff are extremely helpful. We had a king-size bed, and a fireplace, and both were welcoming after a long flight from Ireland. We arrived tired and it was great to feel welcomed and to be offered hospitability without any sense of being stinted. The hotel supplies freshly baked cookies on arrival, there is a coffee maker in the room, and there is a compolimentary wine reception in the evenings which is a great way of making friends with other guests if this is what you want. Breakrfasts, also complimentary, were substantial, with porridge, a cooked dish, and lovely fresh bakery products available. Any help needed was supplied by the friendly staff at the front desk. Rooms on the side of the second floor are quiet. The decor is a nicely judged French Provencal style, and fits in with the calm atmosphere. The lcoatuion is excellent too - a few mintues walk brings you to Union Square and the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hideaway on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: cdolley
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in San Francisco and fell in love with The Petite Auberge. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the overall atmosphere was quaint and charming. Sipping wine in front of the fireplace and visiting with other guests from across the country added a special touch. I really enjoyed having a fireplace in my room. The breakfast was superb and I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A LOVELY STAY!”
Reviews.Author: foodienyc82
Reviews.Content: I was in SF just last week for a conference and stumbled across this hotel during my search on the internet. The pictures are just so lovely from the site that I decided to find out more about it. It got really good marks from the fellow travelors on this site so I booked it! What an excellent choice it turned out to be! I booked a queen deluxe room and it was very spacious and completes with a lovely fireplace!!! It definitely comes in handy at night as it can get quite chilly! The wine reception everynight in addition to a jar of cookies everyday by the front desk makes it feel so cozy and personal. Staffs are really friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about all things SF. One huge plus is that it's very close to the cable car stop and close to all the shopping in town.
